14
/* This file implements modular inversion based on the paper "Fast constant-time gcd computation and
15
 * modular inversion" by Daniel J. Bernstein and Bo-Yin Yang.
16
 *
17
 * For an explanation of the algorithm, see doc/safegcd_implementation.md. This file contains an
18
 * implementation for N=62, using 62-bit signed limbs represented as int64_t.
19
 */
20
21
#ifdef VERIFY
22
/* Helper function to compute the absolute value of an int64_t.
23
 * (we don't use abs/labs/llabs as it depends on the int sizes). */
24
static int64_t secp256k1_modinv64_abs(int64_t v) {
25
    VERIFY_CHECK(v > INT64_MIN);
26
    if (v < 0) return -v;
27
    return v;
28
}
29
30
static const secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 SECP256K1_SIGNED62_ONE = {{1}};
31
32
/* Compute a*factor and put it in r. All but the top limb in r will be in range [0,2^62). */
33
static void secp256k1_modinv64_mul_62(secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 *r, const secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 *a, int alen, int64_t factor) {
34
    const int64_t M62 = (int64_t)(UINT64_MAX >> 2);
35
    int128_t c = 0;
36
    int i;
37
    for (i = 0; i < 4; ++i) {
38
        if (i < alen) c += (int128_t)a->v[i] * factor;
39
        r->v[i] = (int64_t)c & M62; c >>= 62;
40
    }
41
    if (4 < alen) c += (int128_t)a->v[4] * factor;
42
    VERIFY_CHECK(c == (int64_t)c);
43
    r->v[4] = (int64_t)c;
44
}
45
46
/* Return -1 for a<b*factor, 0 for a==b*factor, 1 for a>b*factor. A has alen limbs; b has 5. */
47
static int secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(const secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 *a, int alen, const secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 *b, int64_t factor) {
48
    int i;
49
    secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 am, bm;
50
    secp256k1_modinv64_mul_62(&am, a, alen, 1); /* Normalize all but the top limb of a. */
51
    secp256k1_modinv64_mul_62(&bm, b, 5, factor);
52
    for (i = 0; i < 4; ++i) {
53
        /* Verify that all but the top limb of a and b are normalized. */
54
        VERIFY_CHECK(am.v[i] >> 62 == 0);
55
        VERIFY_CHECK(bm.v[i] >> 62 == 0);
56
    }
57
    for (i = 4; i >= 0; --i) {
58
        if (am.v[i] < bm.v[i]) return -1;
59
        if (am.v[i] > bm.v[i]) return 1;
60
    }
61
    return 0;
62
}
63
#endif
64
65
/* Take as input a signed62 number in range (-2*modulus,modulus), and add a multiple of the modulus
66
 * to it to bring it to range [0,modulus). If sign < 0, the input will also be negated in the
67
 * process. The input must have limbs in range (-2^62,2^62). The output will have limbs in range
68
 * [0,2^62). */
69
14
static void secp256k1_modinv64_normalize_62(secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 *r, int64_t sign, const secp256k1_modinv64_modinfo *modinfo) {
70
14
    const int64_t M62 = (int64_t)(UINT64_MAX >> 2);
71
14
    int64_t r0 = r->v[0], r1 = r->v[1], r2 = r->v[2], r3 = r->v[3], r4 = r->v[4];
72
14
    int64_t cond_add, cond_negate;
73
74
#ifdef VERIFY
75
    /* Verify that all limbs are in range (-2^62,2^62). */
76
    int i;
77
    for (i = 0; i < 5; ++i) {
78
        VERIFY_CHECK(r->v[i] >= -M62);
79
        VERIFY_CHECK(r->v[i] <= M62);
80
    }
81
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(r, 5, &modinfo->modulus, -2) > 0); /* r > -2*modulus */
82
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(r, 5, &modinfo->modulus, 1) < 0); /* r < modulus */
83
#endif
84
85
    /* In a first step, add the modulus if the input is negative, and then negate if requested.
86
     * This brings r from range (-2*modulus,modulus) to range (-modulus,modulus). As all input
87
     * limbs are in range (-2^62,2^62), this cannot overflow an int64_t. Note that the right
88
     * shifts below are signed sign-extending shifts (see assumptions.h for tests that that is
89
     * indeed the behavior of the right shift operator). */
90
14
    cond_add = r4 >> 63;
91
14
    r0 += modinfo->modulus.v[0] & cond_add;
92
14
    r1 += modinfo->modulus.v[1] & cond_add;
93
14
    r2 += modinfo->modulus.v[2] & cond_add;
94
14
    r3 += modinfo->modulus.v[3] & cond_add;
95
14
    r4 += modinfo->modulus.v[4] & cond_add;
96
14
    cond_negate = sign >> 63;
97
14
    r0 = (r0 ^ cond_negate) - cond_negate;
98
14
    r1 = (r1 ^ cond_negate) - cond_negate;
99
14
    r2 = (r2 ^ cond_negate) - cond_negate;
100
14
    r3 = (r3 ^ cond_negate) - cond_negate;
101
14
    r4 = (r4 ^ cond_negate) - cond_negate;
102
    /* Propagate the top bits, to bring limbs back to range (-2^62,2^62). */
103
14
    r1 += r0 >> 62; r0 &= M62;
104
14
    r2 += r1 >> 62; r1 &= M62;
105
14
    r3 += r2 >> 62; r2 &= M62;
106
14
    r4 += r3 >> 62; r3 &= M62;
107
108
    /* In a second step add the modulus again if the result is still negative, bringing
109
     * r to range [0,modulus). */
110
14
    cond_add = r4 >> 63;
111
14
    r0 += modinfo->modulus.v[0] & cond_add;
112
14
    r1 += modinfo->modulus.v[1] & cond_add;
113
14
    r2 += modinfo->modulus.v[2] & cond_add;
114
14
    r3 += modinfo->modulus.v[3] & cond_add;
115
14
    r4 += modinfo->modulus.v[4] & cond_add;
116
    /* And propagate again. */
117
14
    r1 += r0 >> 62; r0 &= M62;
118
14
    r2 += r1 >> 62; r1 &= M62;
119
14
    r3 += r2 >> 62; r2 &= M62;
120
14
    r4 += r3 >> 62; r3 &= M62;
121
122
14
    r->v[0] = r0;
123
14
    r->v[1] = r1;
124
14
    r->v[2] = r2;
125
14
    r->v[3] = r3;
126
14
    r->v[4] = r4;
127
128
#ifdef VERIFY
129
    VERIFY_CHECK(r0 >> 62 == 0);
130
    VERIFY_CHECK(r1 >> 62 == 0);
131
    VERIFY_CHECK(r2 >> 62 == 0);
132
    VERIFY_CHECK(r3 >> 62 == 0);
133
    VERIFY_CHECK(r4 >> 62 == 0);
134
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(r, 5, &modinfo->modulus, 0) >= 0); /* r >= 0 */
135
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(r, 5, &modinfo->modulus, 1) < 0); /* r < modulus */
136
#endif
137
14
}
138
139
/* Data type for transition matrices (see section 3 of explanation).
140
 *
141
 * t = [ u  v ]
142
 *     [ q  r ]
143
 */
144
typedef struct {
145
    int64_t u, v, q, r;
146
} secp256k1_modinv64_trans2x2;
147
148
/* Compute the transition matrix and eta for 59 divsteps (where zeta=-(delta+1/2)).
149
 * Note that the transformation matrix is scaled by 2^62 and not 2^59.
150
 *
151
 * Input:  zeta: initial zeta
152
 *         f0:   bottom limb of initial f
153
 *         g0:   bottom limb of initial g
154
 * Output: t: transition matrix
155
 * Return: final zeta
156
 *
157
 * Implements the divsteps_n_matrix function from the explanation.
158
 */
159
0
static int64_t secp256k1_modinv64_divsteps_59(int64_t zeta, uint64_t f0, uint64_t g0, secp256k1_modinv64_trans2x2 *t) {
160
    /* u,v,q,r are the elements of the transformation matrix being built up,
161
     * starting with the identity matrix times 8 (because the caller expects
162
     * a result scaled by 2^62). Semantically they are signed integers
163
     * in range [-2^62,2^62], but here represented as unsigned mod 2^64. This
164
     * permits left shifting (which is UB for negative numbers). The range
165
     * being inside [-2^63,2^63) means that casting to signed works correctly.
166
     */
167
0
    uint64_t u = 8, v = 0, q = 0, r = 8;
168
0
    uint64_t c1, c2, f = f0, g = g0, x, y, z;
169
0
    int i;
170
171
0
    for (i = 3; i < 62; ++i) {
172
0
        VERIFY_CHECK((f & 1) == 1); /* f must always be odd */
173
0
        VERIFY_CHECK((u * f0 + v * g0) == f << i);
174
0
        VERIFY_CHECK((q * f0 + r * g0) == g << i);
175
        /* Compute conditional masks for (zeta < 0) and for (g & 1). */
176
0
        c1 = zeta >> 63;
177
0
        c2 = -(g & 1);
178
        /* Compute x,y,z, conditionally negated versions of f,u,v. */
179
0
        x = (f ^ c1) - c1;
180
0
        y = (u ^ c1) - c1;
181
0
        z = (v ^ c1) - c1;
182
        /* Conditionally add x,y,z to g,q,r. */
183
0
        g += x & c2;
184
0
        q += y & c2;
185
0
        r += z & c2;
186
        /* In what follows, c1 is a condition mask for (zeta < 0) and (g & 1). */
187
0
        c1 &= c2;
188
        /* Conditionally change zeta into -zeta-2 or zeta-1. */
189
0
        zeta = (zeta ^ c1) - 1;
190
        /* Conditionally add g,q,r to f,u,v. */
191
0
        f += g & c1;
192
0
        u += q & c1;
193
0
        v += r & c1;
194
        /* Shifts */
195
0
        g >>= 1;
196
0
        u <<= 1;
197
0
        v <<= 1;
198
        /* Bounds on zeta that follow from the bounds on iteration count (max 10*59 divsteps). */
199
0
        VERIFY_CHECK(zeta >= -591 && zeta <= 591);
200
0
    }
201
    /* Return data in t and return value. */
202
0
    t->u = (int64_t)u;
203
0
    t->v = (int64_t)v;
204
0
    t->q = (int64_t)q;
205
0
    t->r = (int64_t)r;
206
    /* The determinant of t must be a power of two. This guarantees that multiplication with t
207
     * does not change the gcd of f and g, apart from adding a power-of-2 factor to it (which
208
     * will be divided out again). As each divstep's individual matrix has determinant 2, the
209
     * aggregate of 59 of them will have determinant 2^59. Multiplying with the initial
210
     * 8*identity (which has determinant 2^6) means the overall outputs has determinant
211
     * 2^65. */
212
0
    VERIFY_CHECK((int128_t)t->u * t->r - (int128_t)t->v * t->q == ((int128_t)1) << 65);
213
0
    return zeta;
214
0
}
215
216
/* Compute the transition matrix and eta for 62 divsteps (variable time, eta=-delta).
217
 *
218
 * Input:  eta: initial eta
219
 *         f0:  bottom limb of initial f
220
 *         g0:  bottom limb of initial g
221
 * Output: t: transition matrix
222
 * Return: final eta
223
 *
224
 * Implements the divsteps_n_matrix_var function from the explanation.
225
 */
226
126
static int64_t secp256k1_modinv64_divsteps_62_var(int64_t eta, uint64_t f0, uint64_t g0, secp256k1_modinv64_trans2x2 *t) {
227
    /* Transformation matrix; see comments in secp256k1_modinv64_divsteps_62. */
228
126
    uint64_t u = 1, v = 0, q = 0, r = 1;
229
126
    uint64_t f = f0, g = g0, m;
230
126
    uint32_t w;
231
126
    int i = 62, limit, zeros;
232
233
2.02k
    for (;;) {
234
        /* Use a sentinel bit to count zeros only up to i. */
235
2.02k
        zeros = secp256k1_ctz64_var(g | (UINT64_MAX << i));
236
        /* Perform zeros divsteps at once; they all just divide g by two. */
237
2.02k
        g >>= zeros;
238
2.02k
        u <<= zeros;
239
2.02k
        v <<= zeros;
240
2.02k
        eta -= zeros;
241
2.02k
        i -= zeros;
242
        /* We're done once we've done 62 divsteps. */
243
2.02k
        if (i == 0) break;
244
1.90k
        VERIFY_CHECK((f & 1) == 1);
245
1.90k
        VERIFY_CHECK((g & 1) == 1);
246
1.90k
        VERIFY_CHECK((u * f0 + v * g0) == f << (62 - i));
247
1.90k
        VERIFY_CHECK((q * f0 + r * g0) == g << (62 - i));
248
        /* Bounds on eta that follow from the bounds on iteration count (max 12*62 divsteps). */
249
1.90k
        VERIFY_CHECK(eta >= -745 && eta <= 745);
250
        /* If eta is negative, negate it and replace f,g with g,-f. */
251
1.90k
        if (eta < 0) {
252
1.83k
            uint64_t tmp;
253
1.83k
            eta = -eta;
254
1.83k
            tmp = f; f = g; g = -tmp;
255
1.83k
            tmp = u; u = q; q = -tmp;
256
1.83k
            tmp = v; v = r; r = -tmp;
257
            /* Use a formula to cancel out up to 6 bits of g. Also, no more than i can be cancelled
258
             * out (as we'd be done before that point), and no more than eta+1 can be done as its
259
             * will flip again once that happens. */
260
1.83k
            limit = ((int)eta + 1) > i ? i : ((int)eta + 1);
261
1.83k
            VERIFY_CHECK(limit > 0 && limit <= 62);
262
            /* m is a mask for the bottom min(limit, 6) bits. */
263
1.83k
            m = (UINT64_MAX >> (64 - limit)) & 63U;
264
            /* Find what multiple of f must be added to g to cancel its bottom min(limit, 6)
265
             * bits. */
266
1.83k
            w = (f * g * (f * f - 2)) & m;
267
1.83k
        } else {
268
            /* In this branch, use a simpler formula that only lets us cancel up to 4 bits of g, as
269
             * eta tends to be smaller here. */
270
72
            limit = ((int)eta + 1) > i ? i : ((int)eta + 1);
271
72
            VERIFY_CHECK(limit > 0 && limit <= 62);
272
            /* m is a mask for the bottom min(limit, 4) bits. */
273
72
            m = (UINT64_MAX >> (64 - limit)) & 15U;
274
            /* Find what multiple of f must be added to g to cancel its bottom min(limit, 4)
275
             * bits. */
276
72
            w = f + (((f + 1) & 4) << 1);
277
72
            w = (-w * g) & m;
278
72
        }
279
1.90k
        g += f * w;
280
1.90k
        q += u * w;
281
1.90k
        r += v * w;
282
1.90k
        VERIFY_CHECK((g & m) == 0);
283
1.90k
    }
284
    /* Return data in t and return value. */
285
126
    t->u = (int64_t)u;
286
126
    t->v = (int64_t)v;
287
126
    t->q = (int64_t)q;
288
126
    t->r = (int64_t)r;
289
    /* The determinant of t must be a power of two. This guarantees that multiplication with t
290
     * does not change the gcd of f and g, apart from adding a power-of-2 factor to it (which
291
     * will be divided out again). As each divstep's individual matrix has determinant 2, the
292
     * aggregate of 62 of them will have determinant 2^62. */
293
126
    VERIFY_CHECK((int128_t)t->u * t->r - (int128_t)t->v * t->q == ((int128_t)1) << 62);
294
126
    return eta;
295
126
}
296
297
/* Compute (t/2^62) * [d, e] mod modulus, where t is a transition matrix scaled by 2^62.
298
 *
299
 * On input and output, d and e are in range (-2*modulus,modulus). All output limbs will be in range
300
 * (-2^62,2^62).
301
 *
302
 * This implements the update_de function from the explanation.
303
 */
304
126
static void secp256k1_modinv64_update_de_62(secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 *d, secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 *e, const secp256k1_modinv64_trans2x2 *t, const secp256k1_modinv64_modinfo* modinfo) {
305
126
    const int64_t M62 = (int64_t)(UINT64_MAX >> 2);
306
126
    const int64_t d0 = d->v[0], d1 = d->v[1], d2 = d->v[2], d3 = d->v[3], d4 = d->v[4];
307
126
    const int64_t e0 = e->v[0], e1 = e->v[1], e2 = e->v[2], e3 = e->v[3], e4 = e->v[4];
308
126
    const int64_t u = t->u, v = t->v, q = t->q, r = t->r;
309
126
    int64_t md, me, sd, se;
310
126
    int128_t cd, ce;
311
#ifdef VERIFY
312
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(d, 5, &modinfo->modulus, -2) > 0); /* d > -2*modulus */
313
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(d, 5, &modinfo->modulus, 1) < 0);  /* d <    modulus */
314
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(e, 5, &modinfo->modulus, -2) > 0); /* e > -2*modulus */
315
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(e, 5, &modinfo->modulus, 1) < 0);  /* e <    modulus */
316
    VERIFY_CHECK((secp256k1_modinv64_abs(u) + secp256k1_modinv64_abs(v)) >= 0); /* |u|+|v| doesn't overflow */
317
    VERIFY_CHECK((secp256k1_modinv64_abs(q) + secp256k1_modinv64_abs(r)) >= 0); /* |q|+|r| doesn't overflow */
318
    VERIFY_CHECK((secp256k1_modinv64_abs(u) + secp256k1_modinv64_abs(v)) <= M62 + 1); /* |u|+|v| <= 2^62 */
319
    VERIFY_CHECK((secp256k1_modinv64_abs(q) + secp256k1_modinv64_abs(r)) <= M62 + 1); /* |q|+|r| <= 2^62 */
320
#endif
321
    /* [md,me] start as zero; plus [u,q] if d is negative; plus [v,r] if e is negative. */
322
126
    sd = d4 >> 63;
323
126
    se = e4 >> 63;
324
126
    md = (u & sd) + (v & se);
325
126
    me = (q & sd) + (r & se);
326
    /* Begin computing t*[d,e]. */
327
126
    cd = (int128_t)u * d0 + (int128_t)v * e0;
328
126
    ce = (int128_t)q * d0 + (int128_t)r * e0;
329
    /* Correct md,me so that t*[d,e]+modulus*[md,me] has 62 zero bottom bits. */
330
126
    md -= (modinfo->modulus_inv62 * (uint64_t)cd + md) & M62;
331
126
    me -= (modinfo->modulus_inv62 * (uint64_t)ce + me) & M62;
332
    /* Update the beginning of computation for t*[d,e]+modulus*[md,me] now md,me are known. */
333
126
    cd += (int128_t)modinfo->modulus.v[0] * md;
334
126
    ce += (int128_t)modinfo->modulus.v[0] * me;
335
    /* Verify that the low 62 bits of the computation are indeed zero, and then throw them away. */
336
126
    VERIFY_CHECK(((int64_t)cd & M62) == 0); cd >>= 62;
337
126
    VERIFY_CHECK(((int64_t)ce & M62) == 0); ce >>= 62;
338
    /* Compute limb 1 of t*[d,e]+modulus*[md,me], and store it as output limb 0 (= down shift). */
339
126
    cd += (int128_t)u * d1 + (int128_t)v * e1;
340
126
    ce += (int128_t)q * d1 + (int128_t)r * e1;
341
126
    if (modinfo->modulus.v[1]) { /* Optimize for the case where limb of modulus is zero. */
342
54
        cd += (int128_t)modinfo->modulus.v[1] * md;
343
54
        ce += (int128_t)modinfo->modulus.v[1] * me;
344
54
    }
345
126
    d->v[0] = (int64_t)cd & M62; cd >>= 62;
346
126
    e->v[0] = (int64_t)ce & M62; ce >>= 62;
347
    /* Compute limb 2 of t*[d,e]+modulus*[md,me], and store it as output limb 1. */
348
126
    cd += (int128_t)u * d2 + (int128_t)v * e2;
349
126
    ce += (int128_t)q * d2 + (int128_t)r * e2;
350
126
    if (modinfo->modulus.v[2]) { /* Optimize for the case where limb of modulus is zero. */
351
54
        cd += (int128_t)modinfo->modulus.v[2] * md;
352
54
        ce += (int128_t)modinfo->modulus.v[2] * me;
353
54
    }
354
126
    d->v[1] = (int64_t)cd & M62; cd >>= 62;
355
126
    e->v[1] = (int64_t)ce & M62; ce >>= 62;
356
    /* Compute limb 3 of t*[d,e]+modulus*[md,me], and store it as output limb 2. */
357
126
    cd += (int128_t)u * d3 + (int128_t)v * e3;
358
126
    ce += (int128_t)q * d3 + (int128_t)r * e3;
359
126
    if (modinfo->modulus.v[3]) { /* Optimize for the case where limb of modulus is zero. */
360
0
        cd += (int128_t)modinfo->modulus.v[3] * md;
361
0
        ce += (int128_t)modinfo->modulus.v[3] * me;
362
0
    }
363
126
    d->v[2] = (int64_t)cd & M62; cd >>= 62;
364
126
    e->v[2] = (int64_t)ce & M62; ce >>= 62;
365
    /* Compute limb 4 of t*[d,e]+modulus*[md,me], and store it as output limb 3. */
366
126
    cd += (int128_t)u * d4 + (int128_t)v * e4;
367
126
    ce += (int128_t)q * d4 + (int128_t)r * e4;
368
126
    cd += (int128_t)modinfo->modulus.v[4] * md;
369
126
    ce += (int128_t)modinfo->modulus.v[4] * me;
370
126
    d->v[3] = (int64_t)cd & M62; cd >>= 62;
371
126
    e->v[3] = (int64_t)ce & M62; ce >>= 62;
372
    /* What remains is limb 5 of t*[d,e]+modulus*[md,me]; store it as output limb 4. */
373
126
    d->v[4] = (int64_t)cd;
374
126
    e->v[4] = (int64_t)ce;
375
#ifdef VERIFY
376
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(d, 5, &modinfo->modulus, -2) > 0); /* d > -2*modulus */
377
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(d, 5, &modinfo->modulus, 1) < 0);  /* d <    modulus */
378
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(e, 5, &modinfo->modulus, -2) > 0); /* e > -2*modulus */
379
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(e, 5, &modinfo->modulus, 1) < 0);  /* e <    modulus */
380
#endif
381
126
}
382
383
/* Compute (t/2^62) * [f, g], where t is a transition matrix scaled by 2^62.
384
 *
385
 * This implements the update_fg function from the explanation.
386
 */
387
0
static void secp256k1_modinv64_update_fg_62(secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 *f, secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 *g, const secp256k1_modinv64_trans2x2 *t) {
388
0
    const int64_t M62 = (int64_t)(UINT64_MAX >> 2);
389
0
    const int64_t f0 = f->v[0], f1 = f->v[1], f2 = f->v[2], f3 = f->v[3], f4 = f->v[4];
390
0
    const int64_t g0 = g->v[0], g1 = g->v[1], g2 = g->v[2], g3 = g->v[3], g4 = g->v[4];
391
0
    const int64_t u = t->u, v = t->v, q = t->q, r = t->r;
392
0
    int128_t cf, cg;
393
    /* Start computing t*[f,g]. */
394
0
    cf = (int128_t)u * f0 + (int128_t)v * g0;
395
0
    cg = (int128_t)q * f0 + (int128_t)r * g0;
396
    /* Verify that the bottom 62 bits of the result are zero, and then throw them away. */
397
0
    VERIFY_CHECK(((int64_t)cf & M62) == 0); cf >>= 62;
398
0
    VERIFY_CHECK(((int64_t)cg & M62) == 0); cg >>= 62;
399
    /* Compute limb 1 of t*[f,g], and store it as output limb 0 (= down shift). */
400
0
    cf += (int128_t)u * f1 + (int128_t)v * g1;
401
0
    cg += (int128_t)q * f1 + (int128_t)r * g1;
402
0
    f->v[0] = (int64_t)cf & M62; cf >>= 62;
403
0
    g->v[0] = (int64_t)cg & M62; cg >>= 62;
404
    /* Compute limb 2 of t*[f,g], and store it as output limb 1. */
405
0
    cf += (int128_t)u * f2 + (int128_t)v * g2;
406
0
    cg += (int128_t)q * f2 + (int128_t)r * g2;
407
0
    f->v[1] = (int64_t)cf & M62; cf >>= 62;
408
0
    g->v[1] = (int64_t)cg & M62; cg >>= 62;
409
    /* Compute limb 3 of t*[f,g], and store it as output limb 2. */
410
0
    cf += (int128_t)u * f3 + (int128_t)v * g3;
411
0
    cg += (int128_t)q * f3 + (int128_t)r * g3;
412
0
    f->v[2] = (int64_t)cf & M62; cf >>= 62;
413
0
    g->v[2] = (int64_t)cg & M62; cg >>= 62;
414
    /* Compute limb 4 of t*[f,g], and store it as output limb 3. */
415
0
    cf += (int128_t)u * f4 + (int128_t)v * g4;
416
0
    cg += (int128_t)q * f4 + (int128_t)r * g4;
417
0
    f->v[3] = (int64_t)cf & M62; cf >>= 62;
418
0
    g->v[3] = (int64_t)cg & M62; cg >>= 62;
419
    /* What remains is limb 5 of t*[f,g]; store it as output limb 4. */
420
0
    f->v[4] = (int64_t)cf;
421
0
    g->v[4] = (int64_t)cg;
422
0
}
423
424
/* Compute (t/2^62) * [f, g], where t is a transition matrix for 62 divsteps.
425
 *
426
 * Version that operates on a variable number of limbs in f and g.
427
 *
428
 * This implements the update_fg function from the explanation.
429
 */
430
126
static void secp256k1_modinv64_update_fg_62_var(int len, secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 *f, secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 *g, const secp256k1_modinv64_trans2x2 *t) {
431
126
    const int64_t M62 = (int64_t)(UINT64_MAX >> 2);
432
126
    const int64_t u = t->u, v = t->v, q = t->q, r = t->r;
433
126
    int64_t fi, gi;
434
126
    int128_t cf, cg;
435
126
    int i;
436
126
    VERIFY_CHECK(len > 0);
437
    /* Start computing t*[f,g]. */
438
126
    fi = f->v[0];
439
126
    gi = g->v[0];
440
126
    cf = (int128_t)u * fi + (int128_t)v * gi;
441
126
    cg = (int128_t)q * fi + (int128_t)r * gi;
442
    /* Verify that the bottom 62 bits of the result are zero, and then throw them away. */
443
126
    VERIFY_CHECK(((int64_t)cf & M62) == 0); cf >>= 62;
444
126
    VERIFY_CHECK(((int64_t)cg & M62) == 0); cg >>= 62;
445
    /* Now iteratively compute limb i=1..len of t*[f,g], and store them in output limb i-1 (shifting
446
     * down by 62 bits). */
447
350
    for (i = 1; i < len; ++i) {
448
224
        fi = f->v[i];
449
224
        gi = g->v[i];
450
224
        cf += (int128_t)u * fi + (int128_t)v * gi;
451
224
        cg += (int128_t)q * fi + (int128_t)r * gi;
452
224
        f->v[i - 1] = (int64_t)cf & M62; cf >>= 62;
453
224
        g->v[i - 1] = (int64_t)cg & M62; cg >>= 62;
454
224
    }
455
    /* What remains is limb (len) of t*[f,g]; store it as output limb (len-1). */
456
126
    f->v[len - 1] = (int64_t)cf;
457
126
    g->v[len - 1] = (int64_t)cg;
458
126
}
459
460
/* Compute the inverse of x modulo modinfo->modulus, and replace x with it (constant time in x). */
461
0
static void secp256k1_modinv64(secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 *x, const secp256k1_modinv64_modinfo *modinfo) {
462
    /* Start with d=0, e=1, f=modulus, g=x, zeta=-1. */
463
0
    secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 d = {{0, 0, 0, 0, 0}};
464
0
    secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 e = {{1, 0, 0, 0, 0}};
465
0
    secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 f = modinfo->modulus;
466
0
    secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 g = *x;
467
0
    int i;
468
0
    int64_t zeta = -1; /* zeta = -(delta+1/2); delta starts at 1/2. */
469
470
    /* Do 10 iterations of 59 divsteps each = 590 divsteps. This suffices for 256-bit inputs. */
471
0
    for (i = 0; i < 10; ++i) {
472
        /* Compute transition matrix and new zeta after 59 divsteps. */
473
0
        secp256k1_modinv64_trans2x2 t;
474
0
        zeta = secp256k1_modinv64_divsteps_59(zeta, f.v[0], g.v[0], &t);
475
        /* Update d,e using that transition matrix. */
476
0
        secp256k1_modinv64_update_de_62(&d, &e, &t, modinfo);
477
        /* Update f,g using that transition matrix. */
478
#ifdef VERIFY
479
        VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&f, 5, &modinfo->modulus, -1) > 0); /* f > -modulus */
480
        VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&f, 5, &modinfo->modulus, 1) <= 0); /* f <= modulus */
481
        VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&g, 5, &modinfo->modulus, -1) > 0); /* g > -modulus */
482
        VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&g, 5, &modinfo->modulus, 1) < 0);  /* g <  modulus */
483
#endif
484
0
        secp256k1_modinv64_update_fg_62(&f, &g, &t);
485
#ifdef VERIFY
486
        VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&f, 5, &modinfo->modulus, -1) > 0); /* f > -modulus */
487
        VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&f, 5, &modinfo->modulus, 1) <= 0); /* f <= modulus */
488
        VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&g, 5, &modinfo->modulus, -1) > 0); /* g > -modulus */
489
        VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&g, 5, &modinfo->modulus, 1) < 0);  /* g <  modulus */
490
#endif
491
0
    }
492
493
    /* At this point sufficient iterations have been performed that g must have reached 0
494
     * and (if g was not originally 0) f must now equal +/- GCD of the initial f, g
495
     * values i.e. +/- 1, and d now contains +/- the modular inverse. */
496
#ifdef VERIFY
497
    /* g == 0 */
498
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&g, 5, &SECP256K1_SIGNED62_ONE, 0) == 0);
499
    /* |f| == 1, or (x == 0 and d == 0 and |f|=modulus) */
500
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&f, 5, &SECP256K1_SIGNED62_ONE, -1) == 0 ||
501
                 secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&f, 5, &SECP256K1_SIGNED62_ONE, 1) == 0 ||
502
                 (secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(x, 5, &SECP256K1_SIGNED62_ONE, 0) == 0 &&
503
                  secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&d, 5, &SECP256K1_SIGNED62_ONE, 0) == 0 &&
504
                  (secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&f, 5, &modinfo->modulus, 1) == 0 ||
505
                   secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&f, 5, &modinfo->modulus, -1) == 0)));
506
#endif
507
508
    /* Optionally negate d, normalize to [0,modulus), and return it. */
509
0
    secp256k1_modinv64_normalize_62(&d, f.v[4], modinfo);
510
0
    *x = d;
511
0
}
512
513
/* Compute the inverse of x modulo modinfo->modulus, and replace x with it (variable time). */
514
14
static void secp256k1_modinv64_var(secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 *x, const secp256k1_modinv64_modinfo *modinfo) {
515
    /* Start with d=0, e=1, f=modulus, g=x, eta=-1. */
516
14
    secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 d = {{0, 0, 0, 0, 0}};
517
14
    secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 e = {{1, 0, 0, 0, 0}};
518
14
    secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 f = modinfo->modulus;
519
14
    secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 g = *x;
520
#ifdef VERIFY
521
    int i = 0;
522
#endif
523
14
    int j, len = 5;
524
14
    int64_t eta = -1; /* eta = -delta; delta is initially 1 */
525
14
    int64_t cond, fn, gn;
526
527
    /* Do iterations of 62 divsteps each until g=0. */
528
126
    while (1) {
529
        /* Compute transition matrix and new eta after 62 divsteps. */
530
126
        secp256k1_modinv64_trans2x2 t;
531
126
        eta = secp256k1_modinv64_divsteps_62_var(eta, f.v[0], g.v[0], &t);
532
        /* Update d,e using that transition matrix. */
533
126
        secp256k1_modinv64_update_de_62(&d, &e, &t, modinfo);
534
        /* Update f,g using that transition matrix. */
535
#ifdef VERIFY
536
        VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&f, len, &modinfo->modulus, -1) > 0); /* f > -modulus */
537
        VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&f, len, &modinfo->modulus, 1) <= 0); /* f <= modulus */
538
        VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&g, len, &modinfo->modulus, -1) > 0); /* g > -modulus */
539
        VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&g, len, &modinfo->modulus, 1) < 0);  /* g <  modulus */
540
#endif
541
126
        secp256k1_modinv64_update_fg_62_var(len, &f, &g, &t);
542
        /* If the bottom limb of g is zero, there is a chance that g=0. */
543
126
        if (g.v[0] == 0) {
544
14
            cond = 0;
545
            /* Check if the other limbs are also 0. */
546
14
            for (j = 1; j < len; ++j) {
547
0
                cond |= g.v[j];
548
0
            }
549
            /* If so, we're done. */
550
14
            if (cond == 0) break;
551
14
        }
552
553
        /* Determine if len>1 and limb (len-1) of both f and g is 0 or -1. */
554
112
        fn = f.v[len - 1];
555
112
        gn = g.v[len - 1];
556
112
        cond = ((int64_t)len - 2) >> 63;
557
112
        cond |= fn ^ (fn >> 63);
558
112
        cond |= gn ^ (gn >> 63);
559
        /* If so, reduce length, propagating the sign of f and g's top limb into the one below. */
560
112
        if (cond == 0) {
561
56
            f.v[len - 2] |= (uint64_t)fn << 62;
562
56
            g.v[len - 2] |= (uint64_t)gn << 62;
563
56
            --len;
564
56
        }
565
#ifdef VERIFY
566
        VERIFY_CHECK(++i < 12); /* We should never need more than 12*62 = 744 divsteps */
567
        VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&f, len, &modinfo->modulus, -1) > 0); /* f > -modulus */
568
        VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&f, len, &modinfo->modulus, 1) <= 0); /* f <= modulus */
569
        VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&g, len, &modinfo->modulus, -1) > 0); /* g > -modulus */
570
        VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&g, len, &modinfo->modulus, 1) < 0);  /* g <  modulus */
571
#endif
572
112
    }
573
574
    /* At this point g is 0 and (if g was not originally 0) f must now equal +/- GCD of
575
     * the initial f, g values i.e. +/- 1, and d now contains +/- the modular inverse. */
576
#ifdef VERIFY
577
    /* g == 0 */
578
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&g, len, &SECP256K1_SIGNED62_ONE, 0) == 0);
579
    /* |f| == 1, or (x == 0 and d == 0 and |f|=modulus) */
580
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&f, len, &SECP256K1_SIGNED62_ONE, -1) == 0 ||
581
                 secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&f, len, &SECP256K1_SIGNED62_ONE, 1) == 0 ||
582
                 (secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(x, 5, &SECP256K1_SIGNED62_ONE, 0) == 0 &&
583
                  secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&d, 5, &SECP256K1_SIGNED62_ONE, 0) == 0 &&
584
                  (secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&f, len, &modinfo->modulus, 1) == 0 ||
585
                   secp256k1_modinv64_mul_cmp_62(&f, len, &modinfo->modulus, -1) == 0)));
586
#endif
587
588
    /* Optionally negate d, normalize to [0,modulus), and return it. */
589
14
    secp256k1_modinv64_normalize_62(&d, f.v[len - 1], modinfo);
590
14
    *x = d;
591
14
}

#endif /* SECP256K1_MODINV64_IMPL_H */

#ifndef SECP256K1_MODULE_RECOVERY_MAIN_H
8
#define SECP256K1_MODULE_RECOVERY_MAIN_H

#include "../../../include/secp256k1_recovery.h"

static void secp256k1_ecdsa_recoverable_signature_load(const secp256k1_context* ctx, secp256k1_scalar* r, secp256k1_scalar* s, int* recid, const secp256k1_ecdsa_recoverable_signature* sig) {
13
9
    (void)ctx;
14
9
    if (sizeof(secp256k1_scalar) == 32) {
15
        /* When the secp256k1_scalar type is exactly 32 byte, use its
16
         * representation inside secp256k1_ecdsa_signature, as conversion is very fast.
17
         * Note that secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_save must use the same representation. */
18
9
        memcpy(r, &sig->data[0], 32);
19
9
        memcpy(s, &sig->data[32], 32);
20
9
    } else {
21
0
        secp256k1_scalar_set_b32(r, &sig->data[0], NULL);
22
0
        secp256k1_scalar_set_b32(s, &sig->data[32], NULL);
23
0
    }
24
9
    *recid = sig->data[64];
25
9
}
26
27
9
static void secp256k1_ecdsa_recoverable_signature_save(secp256k1_ecdsa_recoverable_signature* sig, const secp256k1_scalar* r, const secp256k1_scalar* s, int recid) {
28
9
    if (sizeof(secp256k1_scalar) == 32) {
29
9
        memcpy(&sig->data[0], r, 32);
30
9
        memcpy(&sig->data[32], s, 32);
31
9
    } else {
32
0
        secp256k1_scalar_get_b32(&sig->data[0], r);
33
0

static int secp256k1_ecdsa_sig_recover(const secp256k1_ecmult_context *ctx, const secp256k1_scalar *sigr, const secp256k1_scalar* sigs, secp256k1_ge *pubkey, const secp256k1_scalar *message, int recid) {

9

9

96

97

        return 0;
98
0

100

    secp256k1_scalar_get_b32(brx, sigr);

102

103

104

106

107

112
3

113

    secp256k1_gej_set_ge(&xj, &x);

116

/** A scalar modulo the group order of the secp256k1 curve. */
13
typedef struct {
14
    uint64_t d[4];
15
} secp256k1_scalar;
16
17
24
#define SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(d7, d6, d5, d4, d3, d2, d1, d0) {{((uint64_t)(d1)) << 32 | (d0), ((uint64_t)(d3)) << 32 | (d2), ((uint64_t)(d5)) << 32 | (d4), ((uint64_t)(d7)) << 32 | (d6)}}

/* Limbs of the secp256k1 order. */
13
193
#define SECP256K1_N_0 ((uint64_t)0xBFD25E8CD0364141ULL)
14
264
#define SECP256K1_N_1 ((uint64_t)0xBAAEDCE6AF48A03BULL)
15
163
#define SECP256K1_N_2 ((uint64_t)0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFEULL)
16
92
#define SECP256K1_N_3 ((uint64_t)0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL)
17
18
/* Limbs of 2^256 minus the secp256k1 order. */
19
101
#define SECP256K1_N_C_0 (~SECP256K1_N_0 + 1)
20
101
#define SECP256K1_N_C_1 (~SECP256K1_N_1)
21
71
#define SECP256K1_N_C_2 (1)
22
23
/* Limbs of half the secp256k1 order. */
24
0
#define SECP256K1_N_H_0 ((uint64_t)0xDFE92F46681B20A0ULL)
25
0
#define SECP256K1_N_H_1 ((uint64_t)0x5D576E7357A4501DULL)
26
0
#define SECP256K1_N_H_2 ((uint64_t)0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL)
27
0
#define SECP256K1_N_H_3 ((uint64_t)0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL)
28
29

SECP256K1_INLINE static void secp256k1_scalar_clear(secp256k1_scalar *r) {
30
2
    r->d[0] = 0;
31
2
    r->d[1] = 0;
32
2
    r->d[2] = 0;
33
2
    r->d[3] = 0;

2

38
1
    r->d[1] = 0;

1
    r->d[2] = 0;

SECP256K1_INLINE static unsigned int secp256k1_scalar_get_bits(const secp256k1_scalar *a, unsigned int offset, unsigned int count) {
44
1.15k
    VERIFY_CHECK((offset + count - 1) >> 6 == offset >> 6);
45
1.15k
    return (a->d[offset >> 6] >> (offset & 0x3F)) & ((((uint64_t)1) << count) - 1);
46
1.15k
}

361
SECP256K1_INLINE static unsigned int secp256k1_scalar_get_bits_var(const secp256k1_scalar *a, unsigned int offset, unsigned int count) {
49
361
    VERIFY_CHECK(count < 32);
50
361
    VERIFY_CHECK(offset + count <= 256);
51
361
    if ((offset + count - 1) >> 6 == offset >> 6) {
52
322
        return secp256k1_scalar_get_bits(a, offset, count);
53
322
    } else {
54
39
        VERIFY_CHECK((offset >> 6) + 1 < 4);
55
39
        return ((a->d[offset >> 6] >> (offset & 0x3F)) | (a->d[(offset >> 6) + 1] << (64 - (offset & 0x3F)))) & ((((uint64_t)1) << count) - 1);
56
39
    }
57
361
}

SECP256K1_INLINE static int secp256k1_scalar_check_overflow(const secp256k1_scalar *a) {
60
71
    int yes = 0;
61
71
    int no = 0;
62
71
    no |= (a->d[3] < SECP256K1_N_3); /* No need for a > check. */
63
71
    no |= (a->d[2] < SECP256K1_N_2);
64
71
    yes |= (a->d[2] > SECP256K1_N_2) & ~no;
65
71
    no |= (a->d[1] < SECP256K1_N_1);
66
71
    yes |= (a->d[1] > SECP256K1_N_1) & ~no;
67
71
    yes |= (a->d[0] >= SECP256K1_N_0) & ~no;
68
71
    return yes;
69
71
}
70
71
71
SECP256K1_INLINE static int secp256k1_scalar_reduce(secp256k1_scalar *r, unsigned int overflow) {
72
71
    uint128_t t;
73
71
    VERIFY_CHECK(overflow <= 1);
74
71
    t = (uint128_t)r->d[0] + overflow * SECP256K1_N_C_0;
75
71
    r->d[0] = t & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL; t >>= 64;
76
71
    t += (uint128_t)r->d[1] + overflow * SECP256K1_N_C_1;
77
71
    r->d[1] = t & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL; t >>= 64;
78
71
    t += (uint128_t)r->d[2] + overflow * SECP256K1_N_C_2;
79
71
    r->d[2] = t & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL; t >>= 64;
80
71
    t += (uint64_t)r->d[3];
81
71
    r->d[3] = t & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL;
82
71
    return overflow;
83
71
}

13
static int secp256k1_scalar_add(secp256k1_scalar *r, const secp256k1_scalar *a, const secp256k1_scalar *b) {
86
13
    int overflow;
87
13
    uint128_t t = (uint128_t)a->d[0] + b->d[0];
88
13
    r->d[0] = t & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL; t >>= 64;
89
13
    t += (uint128_t)a->d[1] + b->d[1];
90
13
    r->d[1] = t & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL; t >>= 64;
91
13
    t += (uint128_t)a->d[2] + b->d[2];
92
13
    r->d[2] = t & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL; t >>= 64;
93
13
    t += (uint128_t)a->d[3] + b->d[3];
94
13
    r->d[3] = t & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL; t >>= 64;
95
13
    overflow = t + secp256k1_scalar_check_overflow(r);
96
13
    VERIFY_CHECK(overflow == 0 || overflow == 1);
97
13
    secp256k1_scalar_reduce(r, overflow);
98
13
    return overflow;
99
13
}

static void secp256k1_scalar_cadd_bit(secp256k1_scalar *r, unsigned int bit, int flag) {
102
12
    uint128_t t;
103
12
    VERIFY_CHECK(bit < 256);
104
12
    bit += ((uint32_t) flag - 1) & 0x100;  /* forcing (bit >> 6) > 3 makes this a noop */
105
12
    t = (uint128_t)r->d[0] + (((uint64_t)((bit >> 6) == 0)) << (bit & 0x3F));
106
12
    r->d[0] = t & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL; t >>= 64;
107
12
    t += (uint128_t)r->d[1] + (((uint64_t)((bit >> 6) == 1)) << (bit & 0x3F));
108
12
    r->d[1] = t & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL; t >>= 64;
109
12
    t += (uint128_t)r->d[2] + (((uint64_t)((bit >> 6) == 2)) << (bit & 0x3F));
110
12
    r->d[2] = t & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL; t >>= 64;
111
12
    t += (uint128_t)r->d[3] + (((uint64_t)((bit >> 6) == 3)) << (bit & 0x3F));
112
12
    r->d[3] = t & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL;
113
#ifdef VERIFY
114
    VERIFY_CHECK((t >> 64) == 0);
115
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_check_overflow(r) == 0);
116
#endif
117
12
}

static void secp256k1_scalar_set_b32(secp256k1_scalar *r, const unsigned char *b32, int *overflow) {
120
28
    int over;
121
28
    r->d[0] = (uint64_t)b32[31] | (uint64_t)b32[30] << 8 | (uint64_t)b32[29] << 16 | (uint64_t)b32[28] << 24 | (uint64_t)b32[27] << 32 | (uint64_t)b32[26] << 40 | (uint64_t)b32[25] << 48 | (uint64_t)b32[24] << 56;
122
28
    r->d[1] = (uint64_t)b32[23] | (uint64_t)b32[22] << 8 | (uint64_t)b32[21] << 16 | (uint64_t)b32[20] << 24 | (uint64_t)b32[19] << 32 | (uint64_t)b32[18] << 40 | (uint64_t)b32[17] << 48 | (uint64_t)b32[16] << 56;
123
28
    r->d[2] = (uint64_t)b32[15] | (uint64_t)b32[14] << 8 | (uint64_t)b32[13] << 16 | (uint64_t)b32[12] << 24 | (uint64_t)b32[11] << 32 | (uint64_t)b32[10] << 40 | (uint64_t)b32[9] << 48 | (uint64_t)b32[8] << 56;
124
28
    r->d[3] = (uint64_t)b32[7] | (uint64_t)b32[6] << 8 | (uint64_t)b32[5] << 16 | (uint64_t)b32[4] << 24 | (uint64_t)b32[3] << 32 | (uint64_t)b32[2] << 40 | (uint64_t)b32[1] << 48 | (uint64_t)b32[0] << 56;
125
28
    over = secp256k1_scalar_reduce(r, secp256k1_scalar_check_overflow(r));
126
28
    if (overflow) {
127
18
        *overflow = over;
128
18
    }
129
28
}

static void secp256k1_scalar_get_b32(unsigned char *bin, const secp256k1_scalar* a) {
132
10
    bin[0] = a->d[3] >> 56; bin[1] = a->d[3] >> 48; bin[2] = a->d[3] >> 40; bin[3] = a->d[3] >> 32; bin[4] = a->d[3] >> 24; bin[5] = a->d[3] >> 16; bin[6] = a->d[3] >> 8; bin[7] = a->d[3];
133
10
    bin[8] = a->d[2] >> 56; bin[9] = a->d[2] >> 48; bin[10] = a->d[2] >> 40; bin[11] = a->d[2] >> 32; bin[12] = a->d[2] >> 24; bin[13] = a->d[2] >> 16; bin[14] = a->d[2] >> 8; bin[15] = a->d[2];
134
10
    bin[16] = a->d[1] >> 56; bin[17] = a->d[1] >> 48; bin[18] = a->d[1] >> 40; bin[19] = a->d[1] >> 32; bin[20] = a->d[1] >> 24; bin[21] = a->d[1] >> 16; bin[22] = a->d[1] >> 8; bin[23] = a->d[1];
135
10
    bin[24] = a->d[0] >> 56; bin[25] = a->d[0] >> 48; bin[26] = a->d[0] >> 40; bin[27] = a->d[0] >> 32; bin[28] = a->d[0] >> 24; bin[29] = a->d[0] >> 16; bin[30] = a->d[0] >> 8; bin[31] = a->d[0];
136
10
}

SECP256K1_INLINE static int secp256k1_scalar_is_zero(const secp256k1_scalar *a) {
139
46
    return (a->d[0] | a->d[1] | a->d[2] | a->d[3]) == 0;
140
46
}
141
142
21
static void secp256k1_scalar_negate(secp256k1_scalar *r, const secp256k1_scalar *a) {
143
21
    uint64_t nonzero = 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL * (secp256k1_scalar_is_zero(a) == 0);
144
21
    uint128_t t = (uint128_t)(~a->d[0]) + SECP256K1_N_0 + 1;
145
21
    r->d[0] = t & nonzero; t >>= 64;
146
21
    t += (uint128_t)(~a->d[1]) + SECP256K1_N_1;
147
21
    r->d[1] = t & nonzero; t >>= 64;
148
21
    t += (uint128_t)(~a->d[2]) + SECP256K1_N_2;
149
21
    r->d[2] = t & nonzero; t >>= 64;
150
21
    t += (uint128_t)(~a->d[3]) + SECP256K1_N_3;
151
21
    r->d[3] = t & nonzero;
152
21
}

154
0
SECP256K1_INLINE static int secp256k1_scalar_is_one(const secp256k1_scalar *a) {
155
0
    return ((a->d[0] ^ 1) | a->d[1] | a->d[2] | a->d[3]) == 0;
156
0
}
157
158
0
static int secp256k1_scalar_is_high(const secp256k1_scalar *a) {
159
0
    int yes = 0;
160
0
    int no = 0;
161
0
    no |= (a->d[3] < SECP256K1_N_H_3);
162
0
    yes |= (a->d[3] > SECP256K1_N_H_3) & ~no;
163
0
    no |= (a->d[2] < SECP256K1_N_H_2) & ~yes; /* No need for a > check. */
164
0
    no |= (a->d[1] < SECP256K1_N_H_1) & ~yes;
165
0
    yes |= (a->d[1] > SECP256K1_N_H_1) & ~no;
166
0
    yes |= (a->d[0] > SECP256K1_N_H_0) & ~no;
167
0
    return yes;
168
0
}

0
static int secp256k1_scalar_cond_negate(secp256k1_scalar *r, int flag) {
171
    /* If we are flag = 0, mask = 00...00 and this is a no-op;
172
     * if we are flag = 1, mask = 11...11 and this is identical to secp256k1_scalar_negate */
173
0
    uint64_t mask = !flag - 1;
174
0
    uint64_t nonzero = (secp256k1_scalar_is_zero(r) != 0) - 1;
175
0
    uint128_t t = (uint128_t)(r->d[0] ^ mask) + ((SECP256K1_N_0 + 1) & mask);
176
0
    r->d[0] = t & nonzero; t >>= 64;
177
0
    t += (uint128_t)(r->d[1] ^ mask) + (SECP256K1_N_1 & mask);
178
0
    r->d[1] = t & nonzero; t >>= 64;
179
0
    t += (uint128_t)(r->d[2] ^ mask) + (SECP256K1_N_2 & mask);
180
0
    r->d[2] = t & nonzero; t >>= 64;
181
0
    t += (uint128_t)(r->d[3] ^ mask) + (SECP256K1_N_3 & mask);
182
0
    r->d[3] = t & nonzero;
183
0
    return 2 * (mask == 0) - 1;
184
0
}
185
186
/* Inspired by the macros in OpenSSL's crypto/bn/asm/x86_64-gcc.c. */
187
188
/** Add a*b to the number defined by (c0,c1,c2). c2 must never overflow. */
189
918
#define muladd(a,b) { \
190
918
    uint64_t tl, th; \
191
918
    { \
192
918
        uint128_t t = (uint128_t)a * b; \
193
918
        th = t >> 64;         /* at most 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFE */ \
194
918
        tl = t; \
195
918
    } \
196
918
    c0 += tl;                 /* overflow is handled on the next line */ \
197
918
    th += (c0 < tl);          /* at most 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF */ \
198
918
    c1 += th;                 /* overflow is handled on the next line */ \
199
918
    c2 += (c1 < th);          /* never overflows by contract (verified in the next line) */ \
200
918
    VERIFY_CHECK((c1 >= th) || (c2 != 0)); \
201
918
}
202
203
/** Add a*b to the number defined by (c0,c1). c1 must never overflow. */
204
174
#define muladd_fast(a,b) { \
205
174
    uint64_t tl, th; \
206
174
    { \
207
174
        uint128_t t = (uint128_t)a * b; \
208
174
        th = t >> 64;         /* at most 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFE */ \
209
174
        tl = t; \
210
174
    } \
211
174
    c0 += tl;                 /* overflow is handled on the next line */ \
212
174
    th += (c0 < tl);          /* at most 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF */ \
213
174
    c1 += th;                 /* never overflows by contract (verified in the next line) */ \
214
174
    VERIFY_CHECK(c1 >= th); \
215
174
}
216
217
/** Add a to the number defined by (c0,c1,c2). c2 must never overflow. */
218
210
#define sumadd(a) { \
219
210
    unsigned int over; \
220
210
    c0 += (a);                  /* overflow is handled on the next line */ \
221
210
    over = (c0 < (a));         \
222
210
    c1 += over;                 /* overflow is handled on the next line */ \
223
210
    c2 += (c1 < over);          /* never overflows by contract */ \
224
210
}
225
226
/** Add a to the number defined by (c0,c1). c1 must never overflow, c2 must be zero. */
227
150
#define sumadd_fast(a) { \
228
150
    c0 += (a);                 /* overflow is handled on the next line */ \
229
150
    c1 += (c0 < (a));          /* never overflows by contract (verified the next line) */ \
230
150
    VERIFY_CHECK((c1 != 0) | (c0 >= (a))); \
231
150
    VERIFY_CHECK(c2 == 0); \
232
150
}
233
234
/** Extract the lowest 64 bits of (c0,c1,c2) into n, and left shift the number 64 bits. */
235
390
#define extract(n) { \
236
390
    (n) = c0; \
237
390
    c0 = c1; \
238
390
    c1 = c2; \
239
390
    c2 = 0; \
240
390
}
241
242
/** Extract the lowest 64 bits of (c0,c1,c2) into n, and left shift the number 64 bits. c2 is required to be zero. */
243
204
#define extract_fast(n) { \
244
204
    (n) = c0; \
245
204
    c0 = c1; \
246
204
    c1 = 0; \
247
204
    VERIFY_CHECK(c2 == 0); \
248
204
}
249
250
30
static void secp256k1_scalar_reduce_512(secp256k1_scalar *r, const uint64_t *l) {
251
#ifdef USE_ASM_X86_64
252
    /* Reduce 512 bits into 385. */
253
    uint64_t m0, m1, m2, m3, m4, m5, m6;
254
    uint64_t p0, p1, p2, p3, p4;
255
    uint64_t c;
256
257
    __asm__ __volatile__(
258
    /* Preload. */
259
    "movq 32(%%rsi), %%r11\n"
260
    "movq 40(%%rsi), %%r12\n"
261
    "movq 48(%%rsi), %%r13\n"
262
    "movq 56(%%rsi), %%r14\n"
263
    /* Initialize r8,r9,r10 */
264
    "movq 0(%%rsi), %%r8\n"
265
    "xorq %%r9, %%r9\n"
266
    "xorq %%r10, %%r10\n"
267
    /* (r8,r9) += n0 * c0 */
268
    "movq %8, %%rax\n"
269
    "mulq %%r11\n"
270
    "addq %%rax, %%r8\n"
271
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r9\n"
272
    /* extract m0 */
273
    "movq %%r8, %q0\n"
274
    "xorq %%r8, %%r8\n"
275
    /* (r9,r10) += l1 */
276
    "addq 8(%%rsi), %%r9\n"
277
    "adcq $0, %%r10\n"
278
    /* (r9,r10,r8) += n1 * c0 */
279
    "movq %8, %%rax\n"
280
    "mulq %%r12\n"
281
    "addq %%rax, %%r9\n"
282
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r10\n"
283
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
284
    /* (r9,r10,r8) += n0 * c1 */
285
    "movq %9, %%rax\n"
286
    "mulq %%r11\n"
287
    "addq %%rax, %%r9\n"
288
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r10\n"
289
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
290
    /* extract m1 */
291
    "movq %%r9, %q1\n"
292
    "xorq %%r9, %%r9\n"
293
    /* (r10,r8,r9) += l2 */
294
    "addq 16(%%rsi), %%r10\n"
295
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
296
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
297
    /* (r10,r8,r9) += n2 * c0 */
298
    "movq %8, %%rax\n"
299
    "mulq %%r13\n"
300
    "addq %%rax, %%r10\n"
301
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r8\n"
302
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
303
    /* (r10,r8,r9) += n1 * c1 */
304
    "movq %9, %%rax\n"
305
    "mulq %%r12\n"
306
    "addq %%rax, %%r10\n"
307
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r8\n"
308
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
309
    /* (r10,r8,r9) += n0 */
310
    "addq %%r11, %%r10\n"
311
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
312
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
313
    /* extract m2 */
314
    "movq %%r10, %q2\n"
315
    "xorq %%r10, %%r10\n"
316
    /* (r8,r9,r10) += l3 */
317
    "addq 24(%%rsi), %%r8\n"
318
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
319
    "adcq $0, %%r10\n"
320
    /* (r8,r9,r10) += n3 * c0 */
321
    "movq %8, %%rax\n"
322
    "mulq %%r14\n"
323
    "addq %%rax, %%r8\n"
324
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r9\n"
325
    "adcq $0, %%r10\n"
326
    /* (r8,r9,r10) += n2 * c1 */
327
    "movq %9, %%rax\n"
328
    "mulq %%r13\n"
329
    "addq %%rax, %%r8\n"
330
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r9\n"
331
    "adcq $0, %%r10\n"
332
    /* (r8,r9,r10) += n1 */
333
    "addq %%r12, %%r8\n"
334
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
335
    "adcq $0, %%r10\n"
336
    /* extract m3 */
337
    "movq %%r8, %q3\n"
338
    "xorq %%r8, %%r8\n"
339
    /* (r9,r10,r8) += n3 * c1 */
340
    "movq %9, %%rax\n"
341
    "mulq %%r14\n"
342
    "addq %%rax, %%r9\n"
343
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r10\n"
344
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
345
    /* (r9,r10,r8) += n2 */
346
    "addq %%r13, %%r9\n"
347
    "adcq $0, %%r10\n"
348
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
349
    /* extract m4 */
350
    "movq %%r9, %q4\n"
351
    /* (r10,r8) += n3 */
352
    "addq %%r14, %%r10\n"
353
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
354
    /* extract m5 */
355
    "movq %%r10, %q5\n"
356
    /* extract m6 */
357
    "movq %%r8, %q6\n"
358
    : "=g"(m0), "=g"(m1), "=g"(m2), "=g"(m3), "=g"(m4), "=g"(m5), "=g"(m6)
359
    : "S"(l), "i"(SECP256K1_N_C_0), "i"(SECP256K1_N_C_1)
360
    : "rax", "rdx", "r8", "r9", "r10", "r11", "r12", "r13", "r14", "cc");
361
362
    /* Reduce 385 bits into 258. */
363
    __asm__ __volatile__(
364
    /* Preload */
365
    "movq %q9, %%r11\n"
366
    "movq %q10, %%r12\n"
367
    "movq %q11, %%r13\n"
368
    /* Initialize (r8,r9,r10) */
369
    "movq %q5, %%r8\n"
370
    "xorq %%r9, %%r9\n"
371
    "xorq %%r10, %%r10\n"
372
    /* (r8,r9) += m4 * c0 */
373
    "movq %12, %%rax\n"
374
    "mulq %%r11\n"
375
    "addq %%rax, %%r8\n"
376
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r9\n"
377
    /* extract p0 */
378
    "movq %%r8, %q0\n"
379
    "xorq %%r8, %%r8\n"
380
    /* (r9,r10) += m1 */
381
    "addq %q6, %%r9\n"
382
    "adcq $0, %%r10\n"
383
    /* (r9,r10,r8) += m5 * c0 */
384
    "movq %12, %%rax\n"
385
    "mulq %%r12\n"
386
    "addq %%rax, %%r9\n"
387
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r10\n"
388
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
389
    /* (r9,r10,r8) += m4 * c1 */
390
    "movq %13, %%rax\n"
391
    "mulq %%r11\n"
392
    "addq %%rax, %%r9\n"
393
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r10\n"
394
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
395
    /* extract p1 */
396
    "movq %%r9, %q1\n"
397
    "xorq %%r9, %%r9\n"
398
    /* (r10,r8,r9) += m2 */
399
    "addq %q7, %%r10\n"
400
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
401
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
402
    /* (r10,r8,r9) += m6 * c0 */
403
    "movq %12, %%rax\n"
404
    "mulq %%r13\n"
405
    "addq %%rax, %%r10\n"
406
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r8\n"
407
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
408
    /* (r10,r8,r9) += m5 * c1 */
409
    "movq %13, %%rax\n"
410
    "mulq %%r12\n"
411
    "addq %%rax, %%r10\n"
412
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r8\n"
413
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
414
    /* (r10,r8,r9) += m4 */
415
    "addq %%r11, %%r10\n"
416
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
417
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
418
    /* extract p2 */
419
    "movq %%r10, %q2\n"
420
    /* (r8,r9) += m3 */
421
    "addq %q8, %%r8\n"
422
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
423
    /* (r8,r9) += m6 * c1 */
424
    "movq %13, %%rax\n"
425
    "mulq %%r13\n"
426
    "addq %%rax, %%r8\n"
427
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r9\n"
428
    /* (r8,r9) += m5 */
429
    "addq %%r12, %%r8\n"
430
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
431
    /* extract p3 */
432
    "movq %%r8, %q3\n"
433
    /* (r9) += m6 */
434
    "addq %%r13, %%r9\n"
435
    /* extract p4 */
436
    "movq %%r9, %q4\n"
437
    : "=&g"(p0), "=&g"(p1), "=&g"(p2), "=g"(p3), "=g"(p4)
438
    : "g"(m0), "g"(m1), "g"(m2), "g"(m3), "g"(m4), "g"(m5), "g"(m6), "i"(SECP256K1_N_C_0), "i"(SECP256K1_N_C_1)
439
    : "rax", "rdx", "r8", "r9", "r10", "r11", "r12", "r13", "cc");
440
441
    /* Reduce 258 bits into 256. */
442
    __asm__ __volatile__(
443
    /* Preload */
444
    "movq %q5, %%r10\n"
445
    /* (rax,rdx) = p4 * c0 */
446
    "movq %7, %%rax\n"
447
    "mulq %%r10\n"
448
    /* (rax,rdx) += p0 */
449
    "addq %q1, %%rax\n"
450
    "adcq $0, %%rdx\n"
451
    /* extract r0 */
452
    "movq %%rax, 0(%q6)\n"
453
    /* Move to (r8,r9) */
454
    "movq %%rdx, %%r8\n"
455
    "xorq %%r9, %%r9\n"
456
    /* (r8,r9) += p1 */
457
    "addq %q2, %%r8\n"
458
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
459
    /* (r8,r9) += p4 * c1 */
460
    "movq %8, %%rax\n"
461
    "mulq %%r10\n"
462
    "addq %%rax, %%r8\n"
463
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r9\n"
464
    /* Extract r1 */
465
    "movq %%r8, 8(%q6)\n"
466
    "xorq %%r8, %%r8\n"
467
    /* (r9,r8) += p4 */
468
    "addq %%r10, %%r9\n"
469
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
470
    /* (r9,r8) += p2 */
471
    "addq %q3, %%r9\n"
472
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
473
    /* Extract r2 */
474
    "movq %%r9, 16(%q6)\n"
475
    "xorq %%r9, %%r9\n"
476
    /* (r8,r9) += p3 */
477
    "addq %q4, %%r8\n"
478
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
479
    /* Extract r3 */
480
    "movq %%r8, 24(%q6)\n"
481
    /* Extract c */
482
    "movq %%r9, %q0\n"
483
    : "=g"(c)
484
    : "g"(p0), "g"(p1), "g"(p2), "g"(p3), "g"(p4), "D"(r), "i"(SECP256K1_N_C_0), "i"(SECP256K1_N_C_1)
485
    : "rax", "rdx", "r8", "r9", "r10", "cc", "memory");
486
#else
487
30
    uint128_t c;
488
30
    uint64_t c0, c1, c2;
489
30
    uint64_t n0 = l[4], n1 = l[5], n2 = l[6], n3 = l[7];
490
30
    uint64_t m0, m1, m2, m3, m4, m5;
491
30
    uint32_t m6;
492
30
    uint64_t p0, p1, p2, p3;
493
30
    uint32_t p4;
494
495
    /* Reduce 512 bits into 385. */
496
    /* m[0..6] = l[0..3] + n[0..3] * SECP256K1_N_C. */
497
30
    c0 = l[0]; c1 = 0; c2 = 0;
498
30
    muladd_fast(n0, SECP256K1_N_C_0);
499
30
    extract_fast(m0);
500
30
    sumadd_fast(l[1]);
501
30
    muladd(n1, SECP256K1_N_C_0);
502
30
    muladd(n0, SECP256K1_N_C_1);
503
30
    extract(m1);
504
30
    sumadd(l[2]);
505
30
    muladd(n2, SECP256K1_N_C_0);
506
30
    muladd(n1, SECP256K1_N_C_1);
507
30
    sumadd(n0);
508
30
    extract(m2);
509
30
    sumadd(l[3]);
510
30
    muladd(n3, SECP256K1_N_C_0);
511
30
    muladd(n2, SECP256K1_N_C_1);
512
30
    sumadd(n1);
513
30
    extract(m3);
514
30
    muladd(n3, SECP256K1_N_C_1);
515
30
    sumadd(n2);
516
30
    extract(m4);
517
30
    sumadd_fast(n3);
518
30
    extract_fast(m5);
519
30
    VERIFY_CHECK(c0 <= 1);
520
30
    m6 = c0;
521
522
    /* Reduce 385 bits into 258. */
523
    /* p[0..4] = m[0..3] + m[4..6] * SECP256K1_N_C. */
524
30
    c0 = m0; c1 = 0; c2 = 0;
525
30
    muladd_fast(m4, SECP256K1_N_C_0);
526
30
    extract_fast(p0);
527
30
    sumadd_fast(m1);
528
30
    muladd(m5, SECP256K1_N_C_0);
529
30
    muladd(m4, SECP256K1_N_C_1);
530
30
    extract(p1);
531
30
    sumadd(m2);
532
30
    muladd(m6, SECP256K1_N_C_0);
533
30
    muladd(m5, SECP256K1_N_C_1);
534
30
    sumadd(m4);
535
30
    extract(p2);
536
30
    sumadd_fast(m3);
537
30
    muladd_fast(m6, SECP256K1_N_C_1);
538
30
    sumadd_fast(m5);
539
30
    extract_fast(p3);
540
30
    p4 = c0 + m6;
541
30
    VERIFY_CHECK(p4 <= 2);
542
543
    /* Reduce 258 bits into 256. */
544
    /* r[0..3] = p[0..3] + p[4] * SECP256K1_N_C. */
545
30
    c = p0 + (uint128_t)SECP256K1_N_C_0 * p4;
546
30
    r->d[0] = c & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL; c >>= 64;
547
30
    c += p1 + (uint128_t)SECP256K1_N_C_1 * p4;
548
30
    r->d[1] = c & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL; c >>= 64;
549
30
    c += p2 + (uint128_t)p4;
550
30
    r->d[2] = c & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL; c >>= 64;
551
30
    c += p3;
552
30
    r->d[3] = c & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFULL; c >>= 64;
553
30
#endif
554
555
    /* Final reduction of r. */
556
30
    secp256k1_scalar_reduce(r, c + secp256k1_scalar_check_overflow(r));
557
30
}
558
559
42
static void secp256k1_scalar_mul_512(uint64_t l[8], const secp256k1_scalar *a, const secp256k1_scalar *b) {
560
#ifdef USE_ASM_X86_64
561
    const uint64_t *pb = b->d;
562
    __asm__ __volatile__(
563
    /* Preload */
564
    "movq 0(%%rdi), %%r15\n"
565
    "movq 8(%%rdi), %%rbx\n"
566
    "movq 16(%%rdi), %%rcx\n"
567
    "movq 0(%%rdx), %%r11\n"
568
    "movq 8(%%rdx), %%r12\n"
569
    "movq 16(%%rdx), %%r13\n"
570
    "movq 24(%%rdx), %%r14\n"
571
    /* (rax,rdx) = a0 * b0 */
572
    "movq %%r15, %%rax\n"
573
    "mulq %%r11\n"
574
    /* Extract l0 */
575
    "movq %%rax, 0(%%rsi)\n"
576
    /* (r8,r9,r10) = (rdx) */
577
    "movq %%rdx, %%r8\n"
578
    "xorq %%r9, %%r9\n"
579
    "xorq %%r10, %%r10\n"
580
    /* (r8,r9,r10) += a0 * b1 */
581
    "movq %%r15, %%rax\n"
582
    "mulq %%r12\n"
583
    "addq %%rax, %%r8\n"
584
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r9\n"
585
    "adcq $0, %%r10\n"
586
    /* (r8,r9,r10) += a1 * b0 */
587
    "movq %%rbx, %%rax\n"
588
    "mulq %%r11\n"
589
    "addq %%rax, %%r8\n"
590
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r9\n"
591
    "adcq $0, %%r10\n"
592
    /* Extract l1 */
593
    "movq %%r8, 8(%%rsi)\n"
594
    "xorq %%r8, %%r8\n"
595
    /* (r9,r10,r8) += a0 * b2 */
596
    "movq %%r15, %%rax\n"
597
    "mulq %%r13\n"
598
    "addq %%rax, %%r9\n"
599
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r10\n"
600
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
601
    /* (r9,r10,r8) += a1 * b1 */
602
    "movq %%rbx, %%rax\n"
603
    "mulq %%r12\n"
604
    "addq %%rax, %%r9\n"
605
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r10\n"
606
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
607
    /* (r9,r10,r8) += a2 * b0 */
608
    "movq %%rcx, %%rax\n"
609
    "mulq %%r11\n"
610
    "addq %%rax, %%r9\n"
611
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r10\n"
612
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
613
    /* Extract l2 */
614
    "movq %%r9, 16(%%rsi)\n"
615
    "xorq %%r9, %%r9\n"
616
    /* (r10,r8,r9) += a0 * b3 */
617
    "movq %%r15, %%rax\n"
618
    "mulq %%r14\n"
619
    "addq %%rax, %%r10\n"
620
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r8\n"
621
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
622
    /* Preload a3 */
623
    "movq 24(%%rdi), %%r15\n"
624
    /* (r10,r8,r9) += a1 * b2 */
625
    "movq %%rbx, %%rax\n"
626
    "mulq %%r13\n"
627
    "addq %%rax, %%r10\n"
628
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r8\n"
629
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
630
    /* (r10,r8,r9) += a2 * b1 */
631
    "movq %%rcx, %%rax\n"
632
    "mulq %%r12\n"
633
    "addq %%rax, %%r10\n"
634
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r8\n"
635
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
636
    /* (r10,r8,r9) += a3 * b0 */
637
    "movq %%r15, %%rax\n"
638
    "mulq %%r11\n"
639
    "addq %%rax, %%r10\n"
640
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r8\n"
641
    "adcq $0, %%r9\n"
642
    /* Extract l3 */
643
    "movq %%r10, 24(%%rsi)\n"
644
    "xorq %%r10, %%r10\n"
645
    /* (r8,r9,r10) += a1 * b3 */
646
    "movq %%rbx, %%rax\n"
647
    "mulq %%r14\n"
648
    "addq %%rax, %%r8\n"
649
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r9\n"
650
    "adcq $0, %%r10\n"
651
    /* (r8,r9,r10) += a2 * b2 */
652
    "movq %%rcx, %%rax\n"
653
    "mulq %%r13\n"
654
    "addq %%rax, %%r8\n"
655
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r9\n"
656
    "adcq $0, %%r10\n"
657
    /* (r8,r9,r10) += a3 * b1 */
658
    "movq %%r15, %%rax\n"
659
    "mulq %%r12\n"
660
    "addq %%rax, %%r8\n"
661
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r9\n"
662
    "adcq $0, %%r10\n"
663
    /* Extract l4 */
664
    "movq %%r8, 32(%%rsi)\n"
665
    "xorq %%r8, %%r8\n"
666
    /* (r9,r10,r8) += a2 * b3 */
667
    "movq %%rcx, %%rax\n"
668
    "mulq %%r14\n"
669
    "addq %%rax, %%r9\n"
670
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r10\n"
671
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
672
    /* (r9,r10,r8) += a3 * b2 */
673
    "movq %%r15, %%rax\n"
674
    "mulq %%r13\n"
675
    "addq %%rax, %%r9\n"
676
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r10\n"
677
    "adcq $0, %%r8\n"
678
    /* Extract l5 */
679
    "movq %%r9, 40(%%rsi)\n"
680
    /* (r10,r8) += a3 * b3 */
681
    "movq %%r15, %%rax\n"
682
    "mulq %%r14\n"
683
    "addq %%rax, %%r10\n"
684
    "adcq %%rdx, %%r8\n"
685
    /* Extract l6 */
686
    "movq %%r10, 48(%%rsi)\n"
687
    /* Extract l7 */
688
    "movq %%r8, 56(%%rsi)\n"
689
    : "+d"(pb)
690
    : "S"(l), "D"(a->d)
691
    : "rax", "rbx", "rcx", "r8", "r9", "r10", "r11", "r12", "r13", "r14", "r15", "cc", "memory");
692
#else
693
    /* 160 bit accumulator. */
694
42
    uint64_t c0 = 0, c1 = 0;
695
42
    uint32_t c2 = 0;
696
697
    /* l[0..7] = a[0..3] * b[0..3]. */
698
42
    muladd_fast(a->d[0], b->d[0]);
699
42
    extract_fast(l[0]);
700
42
    muladd(a->d[0], b->d[1]);
701
42
    muladd(a->d[1], b->d[0]);
702
42
    extract(l[1]);
703
42
    muladd(a->d[0], b->d[2]);
704
42
    muladd(a->d[1], b->d[1]);
705
42
    muladd(a->d[2], b->d[0]);
706
42
    extract(l[2]);
707
42
    muladd(a->d[0], b->d[3]);
708
42
    muladd(a->d[1], b->d[2]);
709
42
    muladd(a->d[2], b->d[1]);
710
42
    muladd(a->d[3], b->d[0]);
711
42
    extract(l[3]);
712
42
    muladd(a->d[1], b->d[3]);
713
42
    muladd(a->d[2], b->d[2]);
714
42
    muladd(a->d[3], b->d[1]);
715
42
    extract(l[4]);
716
42
    muladd(a->d[2], b->d[3]);
717
42
    muladd(a->d[3], b->d[2]);
718
42
    extract(l[5]);
719
42
    muladd_fast(a->d[3], b->d[3]);
720
42
    extract_fast(l[6]);
721
42
    VERIFY_CHECK(c1 == 0);
722
42
    l[7] = c0;
723
42
#endif
724
42
}
725
726
#undef sumadd
727
#undef sumadd_fast
728
#undef muladd
729
#undef muladd_fast
730
#undef extract
731
#undef extract_fast

30
static void secp256k1_scalar_mul(secp256k1_scalar *r, const secp256k1_scalar *a, const secp256k1_scalar *b) {
734
30
    uint64_t l[8];
735
30
    secp256k1_scalar_mul_512(l, a, b);
736
30
    secp256k1_scalar_reduce_512(r, l);
737
30
}
738
739
0
static int secp256k1_scalar_shr_int(secp256k1_scalar *r, int n) {
740
0
    int ret;
741
0
    VERIFY_CHECK(n > 0);
742
0
    VERIFY_CHECK(n < 16);
743
0
    ret = r->d[0] & ((1 << n) - 1);
744
0
    r->d[0] = (r->d[0] >> n) + (r->d[1] << (64 - n));
745
0
    r->d[1] = (r->d[1] >> n) + (r->d[2] << (64 - n));
746
0
    r->d[2] = (r->d[2] >> n) + (r->d[3] << (64 - n));
747
0
    r->d[3] = (r->d[3] >> n);
748
0
    return ret;
749
0
}
750
751
6
static void secp256k1_scalar_split_128(secp256k1_scalar *r1, secp256k1_scalar *r2, const secp256k1_scalar *k) {
752
6
    r1->d[0] = k->d[0];
753
6
    r1->d[1] = k->d[1];
754
6
    r1->d[2] = 0;
755
6
    r1->d[3] = 0;
756
6
    r2->d[0] = k->d[2];
757
6
    r2->d[1] = k->d[3];
758
6
    r2->d[2] = 0;
759
6
    r2->d[3] = 0;
760
6
}
761
762
0
SECP256K1_INLINE static int secp256k1_scalar_eq(const secp256k1_scalar *a, const secp256k1_scalar *b) {
763
0
    return ((a->d[0] ^ b->d[0]) | (a->d[1] ^ b->d[1]) | (a->d[2] ^ b->d[2]) | (a->d[3] ^ b->d[3])) == 0;
764
0
}
765
766
12
SECP256K1_INLINE static void secp256k1_scalar_mul_shift_var(secp256k1_scalar *r, const secp256k1_scalar *a, const secp256k1_scalar *b, unsigned int shift) {
767
12
    uint64_t l[8];
768
12
    unsigned int shiftlimbs;
769
12
    unsigned int shiftlow;
770
12
    unsigned int shifthigh;
771
12
    VERIFY_CHECK(shift >= 256);
772
12
    secp256k1_scalar_mul_512(l, a, b);
773
12
    shiftlimbs = shift >> 6;
774
12
    shiftlow = shift & 0x3F;
775
12
    shifthigh = 64 - shiftlow;
776
12
    r->d[0] = shift < 512 ? (l[0 + shiftlimbs] >> shiftlow | (shift < 448 && shiftlow ? (l[1 + shiftlimbs] << shifthigh) : 0)) : 0;
777
12
    r->d[1] = shift < 448 ? (l[1 + shiftlimbs] >> shiftlow | (shift < 384 && shiftlow ? (l[2 + shiftlimbs] << shifthigh) : 0)) : 0;
778
12
    r->d[2] = shift < 384 ? (l[2 + shiftlimbs] >> shiftlow | (shift < 320 && shiftlow ? (l[3 + shiftlimbs] << shifthigh) : 0)) : 0;
779
12
    r->d[3] = shift < 320 ? (l[3 + shiftlimbs] >> shiftlow) : 0;
780
12
    secp256k1_scalar_cadd_bit(r, 0, (l[(shift - 1) >> 6] >> ((shift - 1) & 0x3f)) & 1);
781
12
}
782
783
1
static SECP256K1_INLINE void secp256k1_scalar_cmov(secp256k1_scalar *r, const secp256k1_scalar *a, int flag) {
784
1
    uint64_t mask0, mask1;
785
1
    VG_CHECK_VERIFY(r->d, sizeof(r->d));
786
1
    mask0 = flag + ~((uint64_t)0);
787
1
    mask1 = ~mask0;
788
1
    r->d[0] = (r->d[0] & mask0) | (a->d[0] & mask1);
789
1
    r->d[1] = (r->d[1] & mask0) | (a->d[1] & mask1);
790
1
    r->d[2] = (r->d[2] & mask0) | (a->d[2] & mask1);
791
1
    r->d[3] = (r->d[3] & mask0) | (a->d[3] & mask1);
792
1
}
793
794
6
static void secp256k1_scalar_from_signed62(secp256k1_scalar *r, const secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 *a) {
795
6
    const uint64_t a0 = a->v[0], a1 = a->v[1], a2 = a->v[2], a3 = a->v[3], a4 = a->v[4];
796
797
    /* The output from secp256k1_modinv64{_var} should be normalized to range [0,modulus), and
798
     * have limbs in [0,2^62). The modulus is < 2^256, so the top limb must be below 2^(256-62*4).
799
     */
800
6
    VERIFY_CHECK(a0 >> 62 == 0);
801
6
    VERIFY_CHECK(a1 >> 62 == 0);
802
6
    VERIFY_CHECK(a2 >> 62 == 0);
803
6
    VERIFY_CHECK(a3 >> 62 == 0);
804
6
    VERIFY_CHECK(a4 >> 8 == 0);
805
806
6
    r->d[0] = a0      | a1 << 62;
807
6
    r->d[1] = a1 >> 2 | a2 << 60;
808
6
    r->d[2] = a2 >> 4 | a3 << 58;
809
6
    r->d[3] = a3 >> 6 | a4 << 56;
810
811
#ifdef VERIFY
812
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_check_overflow(r) == 0);
813
#endif
814
6
}
815
816
6
static void secp256k1_scalar_to_signed62(secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 *r, const secp256k1_scalar *a) {
817
6
    const uint64_t M62 = UINT64_MAX >> 2;
818
6
    const uint64_t a0 = a->d[0], a1 = a->d[1], a2 = a->d[2], a3 = a->d[3];
819
820
#ifdef VERIFY
821
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_check_overflow(a) == 0);
822
#endif
823
824
6
    r->v[0] =  a0                   & M62;
825
6
    r->v[1] = (a0 >> 62 | a1 <<  2) & M62;
826
6
    r->v[2] = (a1 >> 60 | a2 <<  4) & M62;
827
6
    r->v[3] = (a2 >> 58 | a3 <<  6) & M62;
828
6
    r->v[4] =  a3 >> 56;
829
6
}
830
831
static const secp256k1_modinv64_modinfo secp256k1_const_modinfo_scalar = {
832
    {{0x3FD25E8CD0364141LL, 0x2ABB739ABD2280EELL, -0x15LL, 0, 256}},
833
    0x34F20099AA774EC1LL
834
};
835
836
0
static void secp256k1_scalar_inverse(secp256k1_scalar *r, const secp256k1_scalar *x) {
837
0
    secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 s;
838
#ifdef VERIFY
839
    int zero_in = secp256k1_scalar_is_zero(x);
840
#endif
841
0
    secp256k1_scalar_to_signed62(&s, x);
842
0
    secp256k1_modinv64(&s, &secp256k1_const_modinfo_scalar);
843
0
    secp256k1_scalar_from_signed62(r, &s);
844
845
#ifdef VERIFY
846
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_is_zero(r) == zero_in);
847
#endif
848
0
}
849
850
6
static void secp256k1_scalar_inverse_var(secp256k1_scalar *r, const secp256k1_scalar *x) {
851
6
    secp256k1_modinv64_signed62 s;
852
#ifdef VERIFY
853
    int zero_in = secp256k1_scalar_is_zero(x);
854
#endif
855
6
    secp256k1_scalar_to_signed62(&s, x);
856
6
    secp256k1_modinv64_var(&s, &secp256k1_const_modinfo_scalar);
857
6
    secp256k1_scalar_from_signed62(r, &s);
858
859
#ifdef VERIFY
860
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_is_zero(r) == zero_in);
861
#endif
862
6
}

SECP256K1_INLINE static int secp256k1_scalar_is_even(const secp256k1_scalar *a) {
865
0
    return !(a->d[0] & 1);
866
0
}

7
#ifndef SECP256K1_SCALAR_IMPL_H
8
#define SECP256K1_SCALAR_IMPL_H
9

#ifdef VERIFY
11
#include <string.h>
12
#endif

14
#include "scalar.h"
15
#include "util.h"
16
17
#if defined HAVE_CONFIG_H
18
#include "libsecp256k1-config.h"
19
#endif
20
21
#if defined(EXHAUSTIVE_TEST_ORDER)
22
#include "scalar_low_impl.h"
23
#elif defined(SECP256K1_WIDEMUL_INT128)
24
#include "scalar_4x64_impl.h"
25
#elif defined(SECP256K1_WIDEMUL_INT64)
26
#include "scalar_8x32_impl.h"
27
#else

29

static const secp256k1_scalar secp256k1_scalar_one = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1);
32
static const secp256k1_scalar secp256k1_scalar_zero = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
33

0
static int secp256k1_scalar_set_b32_seckey(secp256k1_scalar *r, const unsigned char *bin) {
35
0
    int overflow;
36
0
    secp256k1_scalar_set_b32(r, bin, &overflow);
37
0
    return (!overflow) & (!secp256k1_scalar_is_zero(r));
38
0
}
39
40
/* These parameters are generated using sage/gen_exhaustive_groups.sage. */
41
#if defined(EXHAUSTIVE_TEST_ORDER)
42
#  if EXHAUSTIVE_TEST_ORDER == 13
43
#    define EXHAUSTIVE_TEST_LAMBDA 9
44
#  elif EXHAUSTIVE_TEST_ORDER == 199
45
#    define EXHAUSTIVE_TEST_LAMBDA 92
46
#  else
47
#    error No known lambda for the specified exhaustive test group order.
48
#  endif
49
50
/**
51
 * Find r1 and r2 given k, such that r1 + r2 * lambda == k mod n; unlike in the
52
 * full case we don't bother making r1 and r2 be small, we just want them to be
53
 * nontrivial to get full test coverage for the exhaustive tests. We therefore
54
 * (arbitrarily) set r2 = k + 5 (mod n) and r1 = k - r2 * lambda (mod n).
55
 */
56
static void secp256k1_scalar_split_lambda(secp256k1_scalar *r1, secp256k1_scalar *r2, const secp256k1_scalar *k) {
57
    *r2 = (*k + 5) % EXHAUSTIVE_TEST_ORDER;
58
    *r1 = (*k + (EXHAUSTIVE_TEST_ORDER - *r2) * EXHAUSTIVE_TEST_LAMBDA) % EXHAUSTIVE_TEST_ORDER;
59
}
60
#else
61
/**
62
 * The Secp256k1 curve has an endomorphism, where lambda * (x, y) = (beta * x, y), where
63
 * lambda is: */
64
static const secp256k1_scalar secp256k1_const_lambda = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(
65
    0x5363AD4CUL, 0xC05C30E0UL, 0xA5261C02UL, 0x8812645AUL,
66
    0x122E22EAUL, 0x20816678UL, 0xDF02967CUL, 0x1B23BD72UL
67
);
68
69
#ifdef VERIFY
70
static void secp256k1_scalar_split_lambda_verify(const secp256k1_scalar *r1, const secp256k1_scalar *r2, const secp256k1_scalar *k);
71
#endif
72
73
/*
74
 * Both lambda and beta are primitive cube roots of unity.  That is lamba^3 == 1 mod n and
75
 * beta^3 == 1 mod p, where n is the curve order and p is the field order.
76
 *
77
 * Futhermore, because (X^3 - 1) = (X - 1)(X^2 + X + 1), the primitive cube roots of unity are
78
 * roots of X^2 + X + 1.  Therefore lambda^2 + lamba == -1 mod n and beta^2 + beta == -1 mod p.
79
 * (The other primitive cube roots of unity are lambda^2 and beta^2 respectively.)
80
 *
81
 * Let l = -1/2 + i*sqrt(3)/2, the complex root of X^2 + X + 1. We can define a ring
82
 * homomorphism phi : Z[l] -> Z_n where phi(a + b*l) == a + b*lambda mod n. The kernel of phi
83
 * is a lattice over Z[l] (considering Z[l] as a Z-module). This lattice is generated by a
84
 * reduced basis {a1 + b1*l, a2 + b2*l} where
85
 *
86
 * - a1 =      {0x30,0x86,0xd2,0x21,0xa7,0xd4,0x6b,0xcd,0xe8,0x6c,0x90,0xe4,0x92,0x84,0xeb,0x15}
87
 * - b1 =     -{0xe4,0x43,0x7e,0xd6,0x01,0x0e,0x88,0x28,0x6f,0x54,0x7f,0xa9,0x0a,0xbf,0xe4,0xc3}
88
 * - a2 = {0x01,0x14,0xca,0x50,0xf7,0xa8,0xe2,0xf3,0xf6,0x57,0xc1,0x10,0x8d,0x9d,0x44,0xcf,0xd8}
89
 * - b2 =      {0x30,0x86,0xd2,0x21,0xa7,0xd4,0x6b,0xcd,0xe8,0x6c,0x90,0xe4,0x92,0x84,0xeb,0x15}
90
 *
91
 * "Guide to Elliptic Curve Cryptography" (Hankerson, Menezes, Vanstone) gives an algorithm
92
 * (algorithm 3.74) to find k1 and k2 given k, such that k1 + k2 * lambda == k mod n, and k1
93
 * and k2 are small in absolute value.
94
 *
95
 * The algorithm computes c1 = round(b2 * k / n) and c2 = round((-b1) * k / n), and gives
96
 * k1 = k - (c1*a1 + c2*a2) and k2 = -(c1*b1 + c2*b2). Instead, we use modular arithmetic, and
97
 * compute r2 = k2 mod n, and r1 = k1 mod n = (k - r2 * lambda) mod n, avoiding the need for
98
 * the constants a1 and a2.
99
 *
100
 * g1, g2 are precomputed constants used to replace division with a rounded multiplication
101
 * when decomposing the scalar for an endomorphism-based point multiplication.
102
 *
103
 * The possibility of using precomputed estimates is mentioned in "Guide to Elliptic Curve
104
 * Cryptography" (Hankerson, Menezes, Vanstone) in section 3.5.
105
 *
106
 * The derivation is described in the paper "Efficient Software Implementation of Public-Key
107
 * Cryptography on Sensor Networks Using the MSP430X Microcontroller" (Gouvea, Oliveira, Lopez),
108
 * Section 4.3 (here we use a somewhat higher-precision estimate):
109
 * d = a1*b2 - b1*a2
110
 * g1 = round(2^384 * b2/d)
111
 * g2 = round(2^384 * (-b1)/d)
112
 *
113
 * (Note that d is also equal to the curve order, n, here because [a1,b1] and [a2,b2]
114
 * can be found as outputs of the Extended Euclidean Algorithm on inputs n and lambda).
115
 *
116
 * The function below splits k into r1 and r2, such that
117
 * - r1 + lambda * r2 == k (mod n)
118
 * - either r1 < 2^128 or -r1 mod n < 2^128
119
 * - either r2 < 2^128 or -r2 mod n < 2^128
120
 *
121
 * See proof below.
122
 */
123
6
static void secp256k1_scalar_split_lambda(secp256k1_scalar *r1, secp256k1_scalar *r2, const secp256k1_scalar *k) {
124
6
    secp256k1_scalar c1, c2;
125
6
    static const secp256k1_scalar minus_b1 = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(
126
6
        0x00000000UL, 0x00000000UL, 0x00000000UL, 0x00000000UL,
127
6
        0xE4437ED6UL, 0x010E8828UL, 0x6F547FA9UL, 0x0ABFE4C3UL
128
6
    );
129
6
    static const secp256k1_scalar minus_b2 = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(
130
6
        0xFFFFFFFFUL, 0xFFFFFFFFUL, 0xFFFFFFFFUL, 0xFFFFFFFEUL,
131
6
        0x8A280AC5UL, 0x0774346DUL, 0xD765CDA8UL, 0x3DB1562CUL
132
6
    );
133
6
    static const secp256k1_scalar g1 = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(
134
6
        0x3086D221UL, 0xA7D46BCDUL, 0xE86C90E4UL, 0x9284EB15UL,
135
6
        0x3DAA8A14UL, 0x71E8CA7FUL, 0xE893209AUL, 0x45DBB031UL
136
6
    );
137
6
    static const secp256k1_scalar g2 = SECP256K1_SCALAR_CONST(
138
6
        0xE4437ED6UL, 0x010E8828UL, 0x6F547FA9UL, 0x0ABFE4C4UL,
139
6
        0x221208ACUL, 0x9DF506C6UL, 0x1571B4AEUL, 0x8AC47F71UL
140
6
    );
141
6
    VERIFY_CHECK(r1 != k);
142
6
    VERIFY_CHECK(r2 != k);
143
    /* these _var calls are constant time since the shift amount is constant */
144
6
    secp256k1_scalar_mul_shift_var(&c1, k, &g1, 384);
145
6
    secp256k1_scalar_mul_shift_var(&c2, k, &g2, 384);
146
6
    secp256k1_scalar_mul(&c1, &c1, &minus_b1);
147
6
    secp256k1_scalar_mul(&c2, &c2, &minus_b2);
148
6
    secp256k1_scalar_add(r2, &c1, &c2);
149
6
    secp256k1_scalar_mul(r1, r2, &secp256k1_const_lambda);
150
6
    secp256k1_scalar_negate(r1, r1);
151
6
    secp256k1_scalar_add(r1, r1, k);
152
153
#ifdef VERIFY
154
    secp256k1_scalar_split_lambda_verify(r1, r2, k);
155
#endif
156
6
}
157
158
#ifdef VERIFY
159
/*
160
 * Proof for secp256k1_scalar_split_lambda's bounds.
161
 *
162
 * Let
163
 *  - epsilon1 = 2^256 * |g1/2^384 - b2/d|
164
 *  - epsilon2 = 2^256 * |g2/2^384 - (-b1)/d|
165
 *  - c1 = round(k*g1/2^384)
166
 *  - c2 = round(k*g2/2^384)
167
 *
168
 * Lemma 1: |c1 - k*b2/d| < 2^-1 + epsilon1
169
 *
170
 *    |c1 - k*b2/d|
171
 *  =
172
 *    |c1 - k*g1/2^384 + k*g1/2^384 - k*b2/d|
173
 * <=   {triangle inequality}
174
 *    |c1 - k*g1/2^384| + |k*g1/2^384 - k*b2/d|
175
 *  =
176
 *    |c1 - k*g1/2^384| + k*|g1/2^384 - b2/d|
177
 * <    {rounding in c1 and 0 <= k < 2^256}
178
 *    2^-1 + 2^256 * |g1/2^384 - b2/d|
179
 *  =   {definition of epsilon1}
180
 *    2^-1 + epsilon1
181
 *
182
 * Lemma 2: |c2 - k*(-b1)/d| < 2^-1 + epsilon2
183
 *
184
 *    |c2 - k*(-b1)/d|
185
 *  =
186
 *    |c2 - k*g2/2^384 + k*g2/2^384 - k*(-b1)/d|
187
 * <=   {triangle inequality}
188
 *    |c2 - k*g2/2^384| + |k*g2/2^384 - k*(-b1)/d|
189
 *  =
190
 *    |c2 - k*g2/2^384| + k*|g2/2^384 - (-b1)/d|
191
 * <    {rounding in c2 and 0 <= k < 2^256}
192
 *    2^-1 + 2^256 * |g2/2^384 - (-b1)/d|
193
 *  =   {definition of epsilon2}
194
 *    2^-1 + epsilon2
195
 *
196
 * Let
197
 *  - k1 = k - c1*a1 - c2*a2
198
 *  - k2 = - c1*b1 - c2*b2
199
 *
200
 * Lemma 3: |k1| < (a1 + a2 + 1)/2 < 2^128
201
 *
202
 *    |k1|
203
 *  =   {definition of k1}
204
 *    |k - c1*a1 - c2*a2|
205
 *  =   {(a1*b2 - b1*a2)/n = 1}
206
 *    |k*(a1*b2 - b1*a2)/n - c1*a1 - c2*a2|
207
 *  =
208
 *    |a1*(k*b2/n - c1) + a2*(k*(-b1)/n - c2)|
209
 * <=   {triangle inequality}
210
 *    a1*|k*b2/n - c1| + a2*|k*(-b1)/n - c2|
211
 * <    {Lemma 1 and Lemma 2}
212
 *    a1*(2^-1 + epslion1) + a2*(2^-1 + epsilon2)
213
 * <    {rounding up to an integer}
214
 *    (a1 + a2 + 1)/2
215
 * <    {rounding up to a power of 2}
216
 *    2^128
217
 *
218
 * Lemma 4: |k2| < (-b1 + b2)/2 + 1 < 2^128
219
 *
220
 *    |k2|
221
 *  =   {definition of k2}
222
 *    |- c1*a1 - c2*a2|
223
 *  =   {(b1*b2 - b1*b2)/n = 0}
224
 *    |k*(b1*b2 - b1*b2)/n - c1*b1 - c2*b2|
225
 *  =
226
 *    |b1*(k*b2/n - c1) + b2*(k*(-b1)/n - c2)|
227
 * <=   {triangle inequality}
228
 *    (-b1)*|k*b2/n - c1| + b2*|k*(-b1)/n - c2|
229
 * <    {Lemma 1 and Lemma 2}
230
 *    (-b1)*(2^-1 + epslion1) + b2*(2^-1 + epsilon2)
231
 * <    {rounding up to an integer}
232
 *    (-b1 + b2)/2 + 1
233
 * <    {rounding up to a power of 2}
234
 *    2^128
235
 *
236
 * Let
237
 *  - r2 = k2 mod n
238
 *  - r1 = k - r2*lambda mod n.
239
 *
240
 * Notice that r1 is defined such that r1 + r2 * lambda == k (mod n).
241
 *
242
 * Lemma 5: r1 == k1 mod n.
243
 *
244
 *    r1
245
 * ==   {definition of r1 and r2}
246
 *    k - k2*lambda
247
 * ==   {definition of k2}
248
 *    k - (- c1*b1 - c2*b2)*lambda
249
 * ==
250
 *    k + c1*b1*lambda + c2*b2*lambda
251
 * ==  {a1 + b1*lambda == 0 mod n and a2 + b2*lambda == 0 mod n}
252
 *    k - c1*a1 - c2*a2
253
 * ==  {definition of k1}
254
 *    k1
255
 *
256
 * From Lemma 3, Lemma 4, Lemma 5 and the definition of r2, we can conclude that
257
 *
258
 *  - either r1 < 2^128 or -r1 mod n < 2^128
259
 *  - either r2 < 2^128 or -r2 mod n < 2^128.
260
 *
261
 * Q.E.D.
262
 */
263
static void secp256k1_scalar_split_lambda_verify(const secp256k1_scalar *r1, const secp256k1_scalar *r2, const secp256k1_scalar *k) {
264
    secp256k1_scalar s;
265
    unsigned char buf1[32];
266
    unsigned char buf2[32];
267
268
    /* (a1 + a2 + 1)/2 is 0xa2a8918ca85bafe22016d0b917e4dd77 */
269
    static const unsigned char k1_bound[32] = {
270
        0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00,
271
        0xa2, 0xa8, 0x91, 0x8c, 0xa8, 0x5b, 0xaf, 0xe2, 0x20, 0x16, 0xd0, 0xb9, 0x17, 0xe4, 0xdd, 0x77
272
    };
273
274
    /* (-b1 + b2)/2 + 1 is 0x8a65287bd47179fb2be08846cea267ed */
275
    static const unsigned char k2_bound[32] = {
276
        0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00,
277
        0x8a, 0x65, 0x28, 0x7b, 0xd4, 0x71, 0x79, 0xfb, 0x2b, 0xe0, 0x88, 0x46, 0xce, 0xa2, 0x67, 0xed
278
    };
279
280
    secp256k1_scalar_mul(&s, &secp256k1_const_lambda, r2);
281
    secp256k1_scalar_add(&s, &s, r1);
282
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_scalar_eq(&s, k));
283
284
    secp256k1_scalar_negate(&s, r1);
285
    secp256k1_scalar_get_b32(buf1, r1);
286
    secp256k1_scalar_get_b32(buf2, &s);
287
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(buf1, k1_bound, 32) < 0 || secp256k1_memcmp_var(buf2, k1_bound, 32) < 0);
288
289
    secp256k1_scalar_negate(&s, r2);
290
    secp256k1_scalar_get_b32(buf1, r2);
291
    secp256k1_scalar_get_b32(buf2, &s);
292
    VERIFY_CHECK(secp256k1_memcmp_var(buf1, k2_bound, 32) < 0 || secp256k1_memcmp_var(buf2, k2_bound, 32) < 0);
293
}
294
#endif /* VERIFY */
295
#endif /* !defined(EXHAUSTIVE_TEST_ORDER) */
296
297
#endif /* SECP256K1_SCALAR_IMPL_H */

static secp256k1_scratch* secp256k1_scratch_create(const secp256k1_callback* error_callback, size_t size) {
14
0
    const size_t base_alloc = ROUND_TO_ALIGN(sizeof(secp256k1_scratch));
15
0
    void *alloc = checked_malloc(error_callback, base_alloc + size);
16
0
    secp256k1_scratch* ret = (secp256k1_scratch *)alloc;
17
0
    if (ret != NULL) {
18
0
        memset(ret, 0, sizeof(*ret));
19
0
        memcpy(ret->magic, "scratch", 8);
20
0
        ret->data = (void *) ((char *) alloc + base_alloc);
21
0
        ret->max_size = size;
22
0
    }
23
0
    return ret;
24
0

27
0
    if (scratch != NULL) {
28
0
        VERIFY_CHECK(scratch->alloc_size == 0); /* all checkpoints should be applied */
29
0
        if (secp256k1_memcmp_var(scratch->magic, "scratch", 8) != 0) {
30
0
            secp256k1_callback_call(error_callback, "invalid scratch space");
31
0
            return;
32
0
        }
33
0

34

35

39
0

40
0
        secp256k1_callback_call(error_callback, "invalid scratch space");
41
0
        return 0;
42
0
    }
43
0
    return scratch->alloc_size;
44
0

47
0
    if (secp256k1_memcmp_var(scratch->magic, "scratch", 8) != 0) {
48
0
        secp256k1_callback_call(error_callback, "invalid scratch space");
49
0
        return;
50
0
    }
51
0
    if (checkpoint > scratch->alloc_size) {
52
0
        secp256k1_callback_call(error_callback, "invalid checkpoint");
53
0

54

56

static size_t secp256k1_scratch_max_allocation(const secp256k1_callback* error_callback, const secp256k1_scratch* scratch, size_t objects) {
59
0
    if (secp256k1_memcmp_var(scratch->magic, "scratch", 8) != 0) {
60
0
        secp256k1_callback_call(error_callback, "invalid scratch space");
61
0
        return 0;
62
0
    }
63
0
    /* Ensure that multiplication will not wrap around */
64
0
    if (ALIGNMENT > 1 && objects > SIZE_MAX/(ALIGNMENT - 1)) {
65
0
        return 0;
66
0
    }
67
0
    if (scratch->max_size - scratch->alloc_size <= objects * (ALIGNMENT - 1)) {
68
0
        return 0;
69
0
    }
70
0
    return scratch->max_size - scratch->alloc_size - objects * (ALIGNMENT - 1);
71
0
}

static void *secp256k1_scratch_alloc(const secp256k1_callback* error_callback, secp256k1_scratch* scratch, size_t size) {
74
0
    void *ret;
75
0
    size_t rounded_size;
76
0
77
0
    rounded_size = ROUND_TO_ALIGN(size);
78
0
    /* Check that rounding did not wrap around */
79
0
    if (rounded_size < size) {
80
0
        return NULL;
81
0
    }
82
0
    size = rounded_size;
83
0
84
0
    if (secp256k1_memcmp_var(scratch->magic, "scratch", 8) != 0) {
85
0
        secp256k1_callback_call(error_callback, "invalid scratch space");
86
0
        return NULL;
87
0
    }
88
0
89
0

90
0
        return NULL;
91
0

92
0

93
0

94

95
0
