size_t secp256k1_context_preallocated_size(unsigned int flags) {
93
2
    size_t ret = ROUND_TO_ALIGN(sizeof(secp256k1_context));
94
    /* A return value of 0 is reserved as an indicator for errors when we call this function internally. */
95
2
    VERIFY_CHECK(ret != 0);
96
97
2
    if (EXPECT((flags & SECP256K1_FLAGS_TYPE_MASK) != SECP256K1_FLAGS_TYPE_CONTEXT, 0)) {
98
0
            secp256k1_callback_call(&default_illegal_callback,
99
0
                                    "Invalid flags");
100
0
            return 0;
101
0
    }
102
103
2
    if (flags & SECP256K1_FLAGS_BIT_CONTEXT_SIGN) {
104
2
        ret += SECP256K1_ECMULT_GEN_CONTEXT_PREALLOCATED_SIZE;
105
2
    }
106
2
    if (flags & SECP256K1_FLAGS_BIT_CONTEXT_VERIFY) {
107
2
        ret += SECP256K1_ECMULT_CONTEXT_PREALLOCATED_SIZE;
108
2
    }
109
2
    return ret;
110
2
}

114
0

115
0

0

117
0

118

0

0

1

126
1
    size_t prealloc_size;
127
1
    secp256k1_context* ret;

1
    if (!secp256k1_selftest()) {

        secp256k1_callback_call(&default_error_callback, "self test failed");
131
0

133
1
    prealloc_size = secp256k1_context_preallocated_size(flags);
134
1
    if (prealloc_size == 0) {
135
0
        return NULL;
136
0
    }
137
1
    VERIFY_CHECK(prealloc != NULL);
138
1
    ret = (secp256k1_context*)manual_alloc(&prealloc, sizeof(secp256k1_context), base, prealloc_size);
139
1
    ret->illegal_callback = default_illegal_callback;
140
1
    ret->error_callback = default_error_callback;
141
142
1
    secp256k1_ecmult_context_init(&ret->ecmult_ctx);
143
1
    secp256k1_ecmult_gen_context_init(&ret->ecmult_gen_ctx);
144
145
    /* Flags have been checked by secp256k1_context_preallocated_size. */
146
1
    VERIFY_CHECK((flags & SECP256K1_FLAGS_TYPE_MASK) == SECP256K1_FLAGS_TYPE_CONTEXT);
147
1
    if (flags & SECP256K1_FLAGS_BIT_CONTEXT_SIGN) {
148
1
        secp256k1_ecmult_gen_context_build(&ret->ecmult_gen_ctx, &prealloc);
149
1
    }
150
1
    if (flags & SECP256K1_FLAGS_BIT_CONTEXT_VERIFY) {
151
1
        secp256k1_ecmult_context_build(&ret->ecmult_ctx, &prealloc);
152
1
    }
153
1
    ret->declassify = !!(flags & SECP256K1_FLAGS_BIT_CONTEXT_DECLASSIFY);
154
155
1
    return (secp256k1_context*) ret;
156
1
}
157

1

161
1

162
0
        free(ctx);
163
0
        return NULL;
164
0
    }
165
166
1
    return ctx;
167
1

/* Mark memory as no-longer-secret for the purpose of analysing constant-time behaviour
238
 *  of the software. This is setup for use with valgrind but could be substituted with
239
 *  the appropriate instrumentation for other analysis tools.
240
 */
241
0
static SECP256K1_INLINE void secp256k1_declassify(const secp256k1_context* ctx, const void *p, size_t len) {
242
#if defined(VALGRIND)
243
    if (EXPECT(ctx->declassify,0)) VALGRIND_MAKE_MEM_DEFINED(p, len);
244
#else
245
0
    (void)ctx;
246
0
    (void)p;
247
0
    (void)len;
248
0
#endif
249
0
}
250
251
5
static int secp256k1_pubkey_load(const secp256k1_context* ctx, secp256k1_ge* ge, const secp256k1_pubkey* pubkey) {
252
5
    if (sizeof(secp256k1_ge_storage) == 64) {
253
        /* When the secp256k1_ge_storage type is exactly 64 byte, use its
254
         * representation inside secp256k1_pubkey, as conversion is very fast.
255
         * Note that secp256k1_pubkey_save must use the same representation. */
256
5
        secp256k1_ge_storage s;
257
5
        memcpy(&s, &pubkey->data[0], sizeof(s));
258
5
        secp256k1_ge_from_storage(ge, &s);
259
5
    } else {
260
        /* Otherwise, fall back to 32-byte big endian for X and Y. */
261
0
        secp256k1_fe x, y;
262
0
        secp256k1_fe_set_b32(&x, pubkey->data);
263
0
        secp256k1_fe_set_b32(&y, pubkey->data + 32);
264
0
        secp256k1_ge_set_xy(ge, &x, &y);
265
0
    }
266
5
    ARG_CHECK(!secp256k1_fe_is_zero(&ge->x));
267
5
    return 1;
268
5
}
269
270
5
static void secp256k1_pubkey_save(secp256k1_pubkey* pubkey, secp256k1_ge* ge) {
271
5
    if (sizeof(secp256k1_ge_storage) == 64) {
272
5
        secp256k1_ge_storage s;
273
5
        secp256k1_ge_to_storage(&s, ge);
274
5
        memcpy(&pubkey->data[0], &s, sizeof(s));
275
5
    } else {
276
0
        VERIFY_CHECK(!secp256k1_ge_is_infinity(ge));
277
0
        secp256k1_fe_normalize_var(&ge->x);
278
0
        secp256k1_fe_normalize_var(&ge->y);
279
0
        secp256k1_fe_get_b32(pubkey->data, &ge->x);
280
0
        secp256k1_fe_get_b32(pubkey->data + 32, &ge->y);
281
0
    }
282
5
}
283
284
0
int secp256k1_ec_pubkey_parse(const secp256k1_context* ctx, secp256k1_pubkey* pubkey, const unsigned char *input, size_t inputlen) {
285
0
    secp256k1_ge Q;
286
287
0
    VERIFY_CHECK(ctx != NULL);
288
0
    ARG_CHECK(pubkey != NULL);
289
0
    memset(pubkey, 0, sizeof(*pubkey));
290
0
    ARG_CHECK(input != NULL);
291
0
    if (!secp256k1_eckey_pubkey_parse(&Q, input, inputlen)) {
292
0
        return 0;
293
0
    }
294
0
    if (!secp256k1_ge_is_in_correct_subgroup(&Q)) {
295
0
        return 0;
296
0
    }
297
0
    secp256k1_pubkey_save(pubkey, &Q);
298
0
    secp256k1_ge_clear(&Q);
299
0
    return 1;
300
0
}
301
302
5
int secp256k1_ec_pubkey_serialize(const secp256k1_context* ctx, unsigned char *output, size_t *outputlen, const secp256k1_pubkey* pubkey, unsigned int flags) {
303
5
    secp256k1_ge Q;
304
5
    size_t len;
305
5
    int ret = 0;
306
307
5
    VERIFY_CHECK(ctx != NULL);
308
5
    ARG_CHECK(outputlen != NULL);
309
5
    ARG_CHECK(*outputlen >= ((flags & SECP256K1_FLAGS_BIT_COMPRESSION) ? 33u : 65u));
310
5
    len = *outputlen;
311
5
    *outputlen = 0;
312
5
    ARG_CHECK(output != NULL);
313
5
    memset(output, 0, len);
314
5
    ARG_CHECK(pubkey != NULL);
315
5
    ARG_CHECK((flags & SECP256K1_FLAGS_TYPE_MASK) == SECP256K1_FLAGS_TYPE_COMPRESSION);
316
5
    if (secp256k1_pubkey_load(ctx, &Q, pubkey)) {
317
5
        ret = secp256k1_eckey_pubkey_serialize(&Q, output, &len, flags & SECP256K1_FLAGS_BIT_COMPRESSION);
318
5
        if (ret) {
319
5
            *outputlen = len;
320
5
        }
321
5
    }
322
5
    return ret;
323
5
}
324
325
0
int secp256k1_ec_pubkey_cmp(const secp256k1_context* ctx, const secp256k1_pubkey* pubkey0, const secp256k1_pubkey* pubkey1) {
326
0
    unsigned char out[2][33];
327
0
    const secp256k1_pubkey* pk[2];
328
0
    int i;
329
330
0
    VERIFY_CHECK(ctx != NULL);
331
0
    pk[0] = pubkey0; pk[1] = pubkey1;
332
0
    for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
333
0
        size_t out_size = sizeof(out[i]);
334
        /* If the public key is NULL or invalid, ec_pubkey_serialize will call
335
         * the illegal_callback and return 0. In that case we will serialize the
336
         * key as all zeros which is less than any valid public key. This
337
         * results in consistent comparisons even if NULL or invalid pubkeys are
338
         * involved and prevents edge cases such as sorting algorithms that use
339
         * this function and do not terminate as a result. */
340
0
        if (!secp256k1_ec_pubkey_serialize(ctx, out[i], &out_size, pk[i], SECP256K1_EC_COMPRESSED)) {
341
            /* Note that ec_pubkey_serialize should already set the output to
342
             * zero in that case, but it's not guaranteed by the API, we can't
343
             * test it and writing a VERIFY_CHECK is more complex than
344
             * explicitly memsetting (again). */
345
0
            memset(out[i], 0, sizeof(out[i]));
346
0
        }
347
0
    }
348
0
    return secp256k1_memcmp_var(out[0], out[1], sizeof(out[0]));
349
0
}

static void secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_load(const secp256k1_context* ctx, secp256k1_scalar* r, secp256k1_scalar* s, const secp256k1_ecdsa_signature* sig) {
352
0
    (void)ctx;
353
0
    if (sizeof(secp256k1_scalar) == 32) {
354

355
         * representation inside secp256k1_ecdsa_signature, as conversion is very fast.
356
         * Note that secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_save must use the same representation. */
357
0
        memcpy(r, &sig->data[0], 32);
358
0
        memcpy(s, &sig->data[32], 32);
359
0
    } else {
360
0
        secp256k1_scalar_set_b32(r, &sig->data[0], NULL);
361
0
        secp256k1_scalar_set_b32(s, &sig->data[32], NULL);
362
0
    }
363

368

369
0

370
0

371
0

int secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_normalize(const secp256k1_context* ctx, secp256k1_ecdsa_signature *sigout, const secp256k1_ecdsa_signature *sigin) {
438
0
    secp256k1_scalar r, s;

    ARG_CHECK(sigin != NULL);

0
    secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_load(ctx, &r, &s, sigin);
445
0
    ret = secp256k1_scalar_is_high(&s);
446
0
    if (sigout != NULL) {
447
0
        if (ret) {
448
0
            secp256k1_scalar_negate(&s, &s);
449
0

450

451
0

int secp256k1_ecdsa_verify(const secp256k1_context* ctx, const secp256k1_ecdsa_signature *sig, const unsigned char *msghash32, const secp256k1_pubkey *pubkey) {
457
0
    secp256k1_ge q;
458
0
    secp256k1_scalar r, s;
459
0
    secp256k1_scalar m;
460
0
    VERIFY_CHECK(ctx != NULL);
461
0
    ARG_CHECK(secp256k1_ecmult_context_is_built(&ctx->ecmult_ctx));
462
0
    ARG_CHECK(msghash32 != NULL);
463
0
    ARG_CHECK(sig != NULL);
464
0
    ARG_CHECK(pubkey != NULL);
465
466
0
    secp256k1_scalar_set_b32(&m, msghash32, NULL);
467
0
    secp256k1_ecdsa_signature_load(ctx, &r, &s, sig);
468
0
    return (!secp256k1_scalar_is_high(&s) &&
469
0
            secp256k1_pubkey_load(ctx, &q, pubkey) &&
470
0
            secp256k1_ecdsa_sig_verify(&ctx->ecmult_ctx, &r, &s, &q, &m));
471
0
}

473
0
static SECP256K1_INLINE void buffer_append(unsigned char *buf, unsigned int *offset, const void *data, unsigned int len) {
474
0
    memcpy(buf + *offset, data, len);
475
0
    *offset += len;
476
0
}
477
478
0
static int nonce_function_rfc6979(unsigned char *nonce32, const unsigned char *msg32, const unsigned char *key32, const unsigned char *algo16, void *data, unsigned int counter) {
479
0
   unsigned char keydata[112];
480
0
   unsigned int offset = 0;
481
0
   secp256k1_rfc6979_hmac_sha256 rng;
482
0
   unsigned int i;
483
   /* We feed a byte array to the PRNG as input, consisting of:
484
    * - the private key (32 bytes) and message (32 bytes), see RFC 6979 3.2d.
485
    * - optionally 32 extra bytes of data, see RFC 6979 3.6 Additional Data.
486
    * - optionally 16 extra bytes with the algorithm name.
487
    * Because the arguments have distinct fixed lengths it is not possible for
488
    *  different argument mixtures to emulate each other and result in the same
489
    *  nonces.
490
    */
491
0
   buffer_append(keydata, &offset, key32, 32);
492
0
   buffer_append(keydata, &offset, msg32, 32);
493
0
   if (data != NULL) {
494
0
       buffer_append(keydata, &offset, data, 32);
495
0
   }
496
0
   if (algo16 != NULL) {
497
0
       buffer_append(keydata, &offset, algo16, 16);
498
0
   }
499
0
   secp256k1_rfc6979_hmac_sha256_initialize(&rng, keydata, offset);
500
0
   memset(keydata, 0, sizeof(keydata));
501
0
   for (i = 0; i <= counter; i++) {
502
0
       secp256k1_rfc6979_hmac_sha256_generate(&rng, nonce32, 32);
503
0
   }
504
0
   secp256k1_rfc6979_hmac_sha256_finalize(&rng);
505
0
   return 1;
506
0
}
507
508
const secp256k1_nonce_function secp256k1_nonce_function_rfc6979 = nonce_function_rfc6979;
509
const secp256k1_nonce_function secp256k1_nonce_function_default = nonce_function_rfc6979;
510
511
0
static int secp256k1_ecdsa_sign_inner(const secp256k1_context* ctx, secp256k1_scalar* r, secp256k1_scalar* s, int* recid, const unsigned char *msg32, const unsigned char *seckey, secp256k1_nonce_function noncefp, const void* noncedata) {
512
0
    secp256k1_scalar sec, non, msg;
513
0
    int ret = 0;
514
0
    int is_sec_valid;
515
0
    unsigned char nonce32[32];
516
0
    unsigned int count = 0;
517
    /* Default initialization here is important so we won't pass uninit values to the cmov in the end */
518
0
    *r = secp256k1_scalar_zero;
519
0
    *s = secp256k1_scalar_zero;
520
0
    if (recid) {
521
0
        *recid = 0;
522
0
    }
523
0
    if (noncefp == NULL) {
524
0
        noncefp = secp256k1_nonce_function_default;
525
0
    }
526
527
    /* Fail if the secret key is invalid. */
528
0
    is_sec_valid = secp256k1_scalar_set_b32_seckey(&sec, seckey);
529
0
    secp256k1_scalar_cmov(&sec, &secp256k1_scalar_one, !is_sec_valid);
530
0
    secp256k1_scalar_set_b32(&msg, msg32, NULL);
531
0
    while (1) {
532
0
        int is_nonce_valid;
533
0
        ret = !!noncefp(nonce32, msg32, seckey, NULL, (void*)noncedata, count);
534
0
        if (!ret) {
535
0
            break;
536
0
        }
537
0
        is_nonce_valid = secp256k1_scalar_set_b32_seckey(&non, nonce32);
538
        /* The nonce is still secret here, but it being invalid is is less likely than 1:2^255. */
539
0
        secp256k1_declassify(ctx, &is_nonce_valid, sizeof(is_nonce_valid));
540
0
        if (is_nonce_valid) {
541
0
            ret = secp256k1_ecdsa_sig_sign(&ctx->ecmult_gen_ctx, r, s, &sec, &msg, &non, recid);
542
            /* The final signature is no longer a secret, nor is the fact that we were successful or not. */
543
0
            secp256k1_declassify(ctx, &ret, sizeof(ret));
544
0
            if (ret) {
545
0
                break;
546
0
            }
547
0
        }
548
0
        count++;
549
0
    }
550
    /* We don't want to declassify is_sec_valid and therefore the range of
551
     * seckey. As a result is_sec_valid is included in ret only after ret was
552
     * used as a branching variable. */
553
0
    ret &= is_sec_valid;
554
0
    memset(nonce32, 0, 32);
555
0
    secp256k1_scalar_clear(&msg);
556
0
    secp256k1_scalar_clear(&non);
557
0
    secp256k1_scalar_clear(&sec);
558
0
    secp256k1_scalar_cmov(r, &secp256k1_scalar_zero, !ret);
559
0
    secp256k1_scalar_cmov(s, &secp256k1_scalar_zero, !ret);
560
0
    if (recid) {
561
0
        const int zero = 0;
562
0
        secp256k1_int_cmov(recid, &zero, !ret);
563
0
    }
564
0
    return ret;
565
0
}

int secp256k1_ec_pubkey_combine(const secp256k1_context* ctx, secp256k1_pubkey *pubnonce, const secp256k1_pubkey * const *pubnonces, size_t n) {

784
0

785
0

0
        return 0;
787
0
    }

790

791
0

static int secp256k1_selftest_sha256(void) {
15
1
    static const char *input63 = "For this sample, this 63-byte string will be used as input data";
16
1
    static const unsigned char output32[32] = {
17
1
        0xf0, 0x8a, 0x78, 0xcb, 0xba, 0xee, 0x08, 0x2b, 0x05, 0x2a, 0xe0, 0x70, 0x8f, 0x32, 0xfa, 0x1e,
18
1
        0x50, 0xc5, 0xc4, 0x21, 0xaa, 0x77, 0x2b, 0xa5, 0xdb, 0xb4, 0x06, 0xa2, 0xea, 0x6b, 0xe3, 0x42,
19
1
    };
20
1
    unsigned char out[32];
21
1
    secp256k1_sha256 hasher;
22
1
    secp256k1_sha256_initialize(&hasher);
23
1
    secp256k1_sha256_write(&hasher, (const unsigned char*)input63, 63);
24
1
    secp256k1_sha256_finalize(&hasher, out);
25
1
    return secp256k1_memcmp_var(out, output32, 32) == 0;
26
1
}

static int secp256k1_selftest(void) {
29
1
    return secp256k1_selftest_sha256();
30

20
    void (*fn)(const char *text, void* data);
21

22

static SECP256K1_INLINE void secp256k1_callback_call(const secp256k1_callback * const cb, const char * const text) {
25
0
    cb->fn(text, (void*)cb->data);
26
0
}

#define TEST_FAILURE(msg) do { \
30
    fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", msg); \
31
    abort(); \
32
} while(0);
33
#else
34
#define TEST_FAILURE(msg) do { \
35
    fprintf(stderr, "%s:%d: %s\n", __FILE__, __LINE__, msg); \
36
    abort(); \
37
} while(0)

#define EXPECT(x,c) __builtin_expect((x),(c))

#ifdef DETERMINISTIC

48
    if (EXPECT(!(cond), 0)) { \
49
        TEST_FAILURE("test condition failed"); \

54

55
        TEST_FAILURE("test condition failed: " #cond); \
56

60
/* Like assert(), but when VERIFY is defined, and side-effect safe. */
61
#if defined(COVERAGE)
62
#define VERIFY_CHECK(check)
63
#define VERIFY_SETUP(stmt)
64
#elif defined(VERIFY)
65
#define VERIFY_CHECK CHECK
66
#define VERIFY_SETUP(stmt) do { stmt; } while(0)
67
#else
68
619k
#define VERIFY_CHECK(cond) do { (void)(cond); } while(0)
69
#define VERIFY_SETUP(stmt)
70
#endif
71
72
/* Define `VG_UNDEF` and `VG_CHECK` when VALGRIND is defined  */
73
#if !defined(VG_CHECK)
74
# if defined(VALGRIND)
75
#  include <valgrind/memcheck.h>
76
#  define VG_UNDEF(x,y) VALGRIND_MAKE_MEM_UNDEFINED((x),(y))
77
#  define VG_CHECK(x,y) VALGRIND_CHECK_MEM_IS_DEFINED((x),(y))
78
# else
79
#  define VG_UNDEF(x,y)
80
#  define VG_CHECK(x,y)
81
# endif
82
#endif
83
84
/* Like `VG_CHECK` but on VERIFY only */
85
#if defined(VERIFY)

#define VG_CHECK_VERIFY(x,y)

static SECP256K1_INLINE void *checked_malloc(const secp256k1_callback* cb, size_t size) {
92
1
    void *ret = malloc(size);
93
1
    if (ret == NULL) {
94
0
        secp256k1_callback_call(cb, "Out of memory");
95
0
    }
96
1
    return ret;
97
1
}

static SECP256K1_INLINE void *checked_realloc(const secp256k1_callback* cb, void *ptr, size_t size) {
100
0
    void *ret = realloc(ptr, size);
101
0
    if (ret == NULL) {
102
0
        secp256k1_callback_call(cb, "Out of memory");
103
0
    }
104
0
    return ret;
105
0
}
106
107
#if defined(__BIGGEST_ALIGNMENT__)
108
18
#define ALIGNMENT __BIGGEST_ALIGNMENT__
109
#else
110
/* Using 16 bytes alignment because common architectures never have alignment
111
 * requirements above 8 for any of the types we care about. In addition we
112
 * leave some room because currently we don't care about a few bytes. */
113
#define ALIGNMENT 16
114
#endif
115
116
6
#define ROUND_TO_ALIGN(size) ((((size) + ALIGNMENT - 1) / ALIGNMENT) * ALIGNMENT)
117
118
/* Assume there is a contiguous memory object with bounds [base, base + max_size)
119
 * of which the memory range [base, *prealloc_ptr) is already allocated for usage,
120
 * where *prealloc_ptr is an aligned pointer. In that setting, this functions
121
 * reserves the subobject [*prealloc_ptr, *prealloc_ptr + alloc_size) of
122
 * alloc_size bytes by increasing *prealloc_ptr accordingly, taking into account
123
 * alignment requirements.
124
 *
125
 * The function returns an aligned pointer to the newly allocated subobject.
126
 *
127
 * This is useful for manual memory management: if we're simply given a block
128
 * [base, base + max_size), the caller can use this function to allocate memory
129
 * in this block and keep track of the current allocation state with *prealloc_ptr.
130
 *
131
 * It is VERIFY_CHECKed that there is enough space left in the memory object and
132
 * *prealloc_ptr is aligned relative to base.
133
 */
134
4
static SECP256K1_INLINE void *manual_alloc(void** prealloc_ptr, size_t alloc_size, void* base, size_t max_size) {
135
4
    size_t aligned_alloc_size = ROUND_TO_ALIGN(alloc_size);
136
4
    void* ret;
137
4
    VERIFY_CHECK(prealloc_ptr != NULL);
138
4
    VERIFY_CHECK(*prealloc_ptr != NULL);
139
4
    VERIFY_CHECK(base != NULL);
140
4
    VERIFY_CHECK((unsigned char*)*prealloc_ptr >= (unsigned char*)base);
141
4
    VERIFY_CHECK(((unsigned char*)*prealloc_ptr - (unsigned char*)base) % ALIGNMENT == 0);
142
4
    VERIFY_CHECK((unsigned char*)*prealloc_ptr - (unsigned char*)base + aligned_alloc_size <= max_size);
143
4
    ret = *prealloc_ptr;
144
4
    *prealloc_ptr = (unsigned char*)*prealloc_ptr + aligned_alloc_size;
145
4
    return ret;
146
4
}
147
148
/* Macro for restrict, when available and not in a VERIFY build. */
149
#if defined(SECP256K1_BUILD) && defined(VERIFY)
150
# define SECP256K1_RESTRICT
151
#else
152
# if (!defined(__STDC_VERSION__) || (__STDC_VERSION__ < 199901L) )
153
#  if SECP256K1_GNUC_PREREQ(3,0)
154
#   define SECP256K1_RESTRICT __restrict__
155
#  elif (defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >= 1400)
156
#   define SECP256K1_RESTRICT __restrict
157
#  else
158
#   define SECP256K1_RESTRICT
159
#  endif
160
# else
161
#  define SECP256K1_RESTRICT restrict
162
# endif
163
#endif
164
165
#if defined(_WIN32)
166
# define I64FORMAT "I64d"
167
# define I64uFORMAT "I64u"
168
#else
169
# define I64FORMAT "lld"
170
# define I64uFORMAT "llu"
171
#endif

#if defined(__GNUC__)
174
# define SECP256K1_GNUC_EXT __extension__
175
#else

# define SECP256K1_GNUC_EXT
177
#endif

/* If SECP256K1_{LITTLE,BIG}_ENDIAN is not explicitly provided, infer from various other system macros. */
180
#if !defined(SECP256K1_LITTLE_ENDIAN) && !defined(SECP256K1_BIG_ENDIAN)
181
/* Inspired by https://github.com/rofl0r/endianness.h/blob/9853923246b065a3b52d2c43835f3819a62c7199/endianness.h#L52L73 */
182
# if (defined(__BYTE_ORDER__) && defined(__ORDER_LITTLE_ENDIAN__) && __BYTE_ORDER__ == __ORDER_LITTLE_ENDIAN__) || \
183
     defined(_X86_) || defined(__x86_64__) || defined(__i386__) || \
184
     defined(__i486__) || defined(__i586__) || defined(__i686__) || \
185
     defined(__MIPSEL) || defined(_MIPSEL) || defined(MIPSEL) || \
186
     defined(__ARMEL__) || defined(__AARCH64EL__) || \
187
     (defined(__LITTLE_ENDIAN__) && __LITTLE_ENDIAN__ == 1) || \
188
     (defined(_LITTLE_ENDIAN) && _LITTLE_ENDIAN == 1) || \
189
     defined(_M_IX86) || defined(_M_AMD64) || defined(_M_ARM) /* MSVC */
190
#  define SECP256K1_LITTLE_ENDIAN
191
# endif
192
# if (defined(__BYTE_ORDER__) && defined(__ORDER_BIG_ENDIAN__) && __BYTE_ORDER__ == __ORDER_BIG_ENDIAN__) || \
193
     defined(__MIPSEB) || defined(_MIPSEB) || defined(MIPSEB) || \
194
     defined(__MICROBLAZEEB__) || defined(__ARMEB__) || defined(__AARCH64EB__) || \
195
     (defined(__BIG_ENDIAN__) && __BIG_ENDIAN__ == 1) || \
196
     (defined(_BIG_ENDIAN) && _BIG_ENDIAN == 1)
197
#  define SECP256K1_BIG_ENDIAN
198
# endif
199
#endif
200
#if defined(SECP256K1_LITTLE_ENDIAN) == defined(SECP256K1_BIG_ENDIAN)
201
# error Please make sure that either SECP256K1_LITTLE_ENDIAN or SECP256K1_BIG_ENDIAN is set, see src/util.h.
202
#endif
203
204
/* Zero memory if flag == 1. Flag must be 0 or 1. Constant time. */
205
0
static SECP256K1_INLINE void secp256k1_memczero(void *s, size_t len, int flag) {
206
0
    unsigned char *p = (unsigned char *)s;
207
    /* Access flag with a volatile-qualified lvalue.
208
       This prevents clang from figuring out (after inlining) that flag can
209
       take only be 0 or 1, which leads to variable time code. */
210
0
    volatile int vflag = flag;
211
0
    unsigned char mask = -(unsigned char) vflag;
212
0
    while (len) {
213
0
        *p &= ~mask;
214
0
        p++;
215
0
        len--;
216
0
    }
217
0
}
218
219
/** Semantics like memcmp. Variable-time.
220
 *
221
 * We use this to avoid possible compiler bugs with memcmp, e.g.
222
 * https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=95189
223
 */
224
1
static SECP256K1_INLINE int secp256k1_memcmp_var(const void *s1, const void *s2, size_t n) {
225
1
    const unsigned char *p1 = s1, *p2 = s2;
226
1
    size_t i;
227
228
33
    for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
229
32
        int diff = p1[i] - p2[i];
230
32
        if (diff != 0) {
231
0
            return diff;
232
0
        }
233
32
    }
234
1
    return 0;
235
1
}
236
237
/** If flag is true, set *r equal to *a; otherwise leave it. Constant-time.  Both *r and *a must be initialized and non-negative.*/
238
0
static SECP256K1_INLINE void secp256k1_int_cmov(int *r, const int *a, int flag) {
239
0
    unsigned int mask0, mask1, r_masked, a_masked;
240
    /* Access flag with a volatile-qualified lvalue.
241
       This prevents clang from figuring out (after inlining) that flag can
242
       take only be 0 or 1, which leads to variable time code. */
243
0
    volatile int vflag = flag;
244
245
    /* Casting a negative int to unsigned and back to int is implementation defined behavior */
246
0
    VERIFY_CHECK(*r >= 0 && *a >= 0);
247
248
0
    mask0 = (unsigned int)vflag + ~0u;
249
0
    mask1 = ~mask0;
250
0
    r_masked = ((unsigned int)*r & mask0);
251
0
    a_masked = ((unsigned int)*a & mask1);
252
253
0
    *r = (int)(r_masked | a_masked);
254
0
}
255
256
/* If USE_FORCE_WIDEMUL_{INT128,INT64} is set, use that wide multiplication implementation.
257
 * Otherwise use the presence of __SIZEOF_INT128__ to decide.
258
 */
259
#if defined(USE_FORCE_WIDEMUL_INT128)
260
# define SECP256K1_WIDEMUL_INT128 1
261
#elif defined(USE_FORCE_WIDEMUL_INT64)
262
# define SECP256K1_WIDEMUL_INT64 1
263
#elif defined(UINT128_MAX) || defined(__SIZEOF_INT128__)
264
# define SECP256K1_WIDEMUL_INT128 1
265
#else
266
# define SECP256K1_WIDEMUL_INT64 1
267
#endif
268
#if defined(SECP256K1_WIDEMUL_INT128)
269
# if !defined(UINT128_MAX) && defined(__SIZEOF_INT128__)
270
SECP256K1_GNUC_EXT typedef unsigned __int128 uint128_t;
271
SECP256K1_GNUC_EXT typedef __int128 int128_t;
272
#define UINT128_MAX ((uint128_t)(-1))
273
#define INT128_MAX ((int128_t)(UINT128_MAX >> 1))
274
#define INT128_MIN (-INT128_MAX - 1)
275
/* No (U)INT128_C macros because compilers providing __int128 do not support 128-bit literals.  */
276
# endif
277
#endif
278
279
#ifndef __has_builtin
280
#define __has_builtin(x) 0
281
#endif
282
283
/* Determine the number of trailing zero bits in a (non-zero) 32-bit x.
284
 * This function is only intended to be used as fallback for
285
 * secp256k1_ctz32_var, but permits it to be tested separately. */
286
0
static SECP256K1_INLINE int secp256k1_ctz32_var_debruijn(uint32_t x) {
287
0
    static const uint8_t debruijn[32] = {
288
0
        0x00, 0x01, 0x02, 0x18, 0x03, 0x13, 0x06, 0x19, 0x16, 0x04, 0x14, 0x0A,
289
0
        0x10, 0x07, 0x0C, 0x1A, 0x1F, 0x17, 0x12, 0x05, 0x15, 0x09, 0x0F, 0x0B,
290
0
        0x1E, 0x11, 0x08, 0x0E, 0x1D, 0x0D, 0x1C, 0x1B
291
0
    };
292
0
    return debruijn[((x & -x) * 0x04D7651F) >> 27];
293
0
}
294
295
/* Determine the number of trailing zero bits in a (non-zero) 64-bit x.
296
 * This function is only intended to be used as fallback for
297
 * secp256k1_ctz64_var, but permits it to be tested separately. */
298
0
static SECP256K1_INLINE int secp256k1_ctz64_var_debruijn(uint64_t x) {
299
0
    static const uint8_t debruijn[64] = {
300
0
        0, 1, 2, 53, 3, 7, 54, 27, 4, 38, 41, 8, 34, 55, 48, 28,
301
0
        62, 5, 39, 46, 44, 42, 22, 9, 24, 35, 59, 56, 49, 18, 29, 11,
302
0
        63, 52, 6, 26, 37, 40, 33, 47, 61, 45, 43, 21, 23, 58, 17, 10,
303
0
        51, 25, 36, 32, 60, 20, 57, 16, 50, 31, 19, 15, 30, 14, 13, 12
304
0
    };
305
0
    return debruijn[((x & -x) * 0x022FDD63CC95386D) >> 58];
306
0
}
307
308
/* Determine the number of trailing zero bits in a (non-zero) 32-bit x. */
309
0
static SECP256K1_INLINE int secp256k1_ctz32_var(uint32_t x) {
310
0
    VERIFY_CHECK(x != 0);
311
0
#if (__has_builtin(__builtin_ctz) || SECP256K1_GNUC_PREREQ(3,4))
312
0
    /* If the unsigned type is sufficient to represent the largest uint32_t, consider __builtin_ctz. */
313
0
    if (((unsigned)UINT32_MAX) == UINT32_MAX) {
314
0
        return __builtin_ctz(x);
315
0
    }
316
0
#endif
317
0
#if (__has_builtin(__builtin_ctzl) || SECP256K1_GNUC_PREREQ(3,4))
318
0
    /* Otherwise consider __builtin_ctzl (the unsigned long type is always at least 32 bits). */
319
0
    return __builtin_ctzl(x);
320
0
#else
321
0
    /* If no suitable CTZ builtin is available, use a (variable time) software emulation. */
322
0
    return secp256k1_ctz32_var_debruijn(x);
323
0
#endif
324
0
}
325
326
/* Determine the number of trailing zero bits in a (non-zero) 64-bit x. */
327
2.02k
static SECP256K1_INLINE int secp256k1_ctz64_var(uint64_t x) {
328
2.02k
    VERIFY_CHECK(x != 0);
329
2.02k
#if (__has_builtin(__builtin_ctzl) || SECP256K1_GNUC_PREREQ(3,4))
330
    /* If the unsigned long type is sufficient to represent the largest uint64_t, consider __builtin_ctzl. */
331
2.02k
    if (((unsigned long)UINT64_MAX) == UINT64_MAX) {
332
2.02k
        return __builtin_ctzl(x);
333
2.02k
    }
334
0
#endif
335
0
#if (__has_builtin(__builtin_ctzll) || SECP256K1_GNUC_PREREQ(3,4))
336
    /* Otherwise consider __builtin_ctzll (the unsigned long long type is always at least 64 bits). */
337
0
    return __builtin_ctzll(x);
338
#else
339
    /* If no suitable CTZ builtin is available, use a (variable time) software emulation. */
340
    return secp256k1_ctz64_var_debruijn(x);
341
#endif
342
2.02k
}
